items.content:
Senior Software Developer- Supply Chain

United States, Massachusetts
Company: Wayfair

Overview

Wayfair is one of the world s largest online destinations for the home. We re the creative builders solving complex business problems through the newest and most innovative software in e-commerce. From our Proprietary Logistics to Platform Development, to key Infrastructure Engineering, we leverage various techniques to create our own innovative platforms and engineering tools! Our agile continuous deployment environment promotes frequent releases to production. We move fast, build to scale and approach each challenge with agility and creativity. (Inbound Logistics/ Strategic Leaders) We are looking for experienced, Full-Stack Engineering Leader to join our Inbound Logistics Team. Inbound owns the complex world of International Supply Chain. With an ever-evolving logistical complexity, this newly formed team aims to perfect ocean shipping across the globe. Working with critical suppliers to help them consolidate product and come up with creative solutions to meet their shipping needs. They prototype, build, and scale the tools used by Wayfair on an International Domain. The team is looking for people to help our ongoing efforts to scale, including building a custom web portal for the supplier, so they can update, track and adjust shipping inventory from anywhere in the world. We are looking for a candidate who is strong in creating API s, dashboards and has a strong familiarization with various automation tools. Candidates who have a strong understand of best practices when it comes to Micro-services, Kubernetes and containerization are preferred but not required. If you have a background working with complex data systems and platform development, while fast iteration in an agile environment, this is the role for you. We deeply value curiosity, collaboration, and an eagerness to make an impact on the business. What You’ll Do Lead technical road-maps, design, and implementation within a team of high performing engineers that will shape the future of Inbound Logistics and how Wayfair strategically moves very large items from suppliers to warehouses across the world. Actively network within Engineering to establish rapport with other leaders across the organization Mentors new hires and other engineers to help them level up and become more proficient by example, tech talks, pairing, and other avenues to increase technical efficiency across the organization. Handle ambiguity with limited oversight; leverage technical acumen, experience, and network to answer questions and remove roadblocks. Propose and own initiatives to completion while balancing various trade offs including speed to delivery vs ongoing maintainability and others. Provide high-quality code reviews and technically complex architectural designs Bring in new ideas from other internal teams as well as external best practices Participates with leadership in making decisions around road-maps Collaborates well with senior management, product managers, and all other stakeholders What You’ll Need Mastery of a modern programming language (preferably Python) Experience mentoring junior engineers Experience leading a large, cross-cutting technical initiative to delivery Proficient in cross-functional consensus building and influencing without authority Proficient in designing systems at scale Proficient in effective troubleshooting and issue resolution techniques Proficient in a modern frontend framework (preferably React) Proficient in writing SQL queries against a relational database About Us Wayfair is one of the world s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking. No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair and the world for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That s why we re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information. Associated topics: .net, application architect, application developer, architect, c#, maven, perl, php, senior, senior software engineer

Apply for job

items.content:
Who we are


AppyWay is on a mission to helping cities thrive, from the kerb up. We understand how fragmented infrastructures and stand-alone solutions cause stress and hassle for the most mundane of daily tasks, like finding and paying for a parking space. We know there’s a better way of doing things and so we’re building innovative and future-ready solutions from the bottom up, to improve the way parking is accessed and managed.


Our holistic kerbside management platform provides a ‘future of mobility’ conduit between the private and public sector, ensuring standardised kerbside data can flow between local authorities and mobility operators, unlocking the barriers that hinder the adoption of intelligent mobility solutions and ultimately make the kerb work for everyone, physically, socially and commercially.


AppyWay is backed by a number of leading investors including Hyundai Motors and Sumitomo Corporation, and recently closed a significant £7.6 million Series A funding round.


We’ve won several prestigious awards over the years including more recently Best Transportation-as-a-Service Project Award from the TaaS Technology Conference as well as being ranked as a top 50 disruptive UK company in the 2019 Disruption 50 Index.


We’re building something big, from the ground up, so this is a great chance to get on board with that and make a mark on a company that you can call your own.




REQUIREMENTS


So what is a developer in AppyWay? A team player? Autonomous? A rock-star? A self-starter? Yes (but all JDs say that right?). But you are also adaptable, dependable, sociable. At your heart you are a passionate problem solver, an engineer. You like “sleeves rolled up headphones on don’t talk to me I’m in the zone ok i’m done where’s the pub” you are that kind of animal. You know that sometimes it’s a one-person problem and sometimes it’s a team one - you’ll play different roles at different times.


Generally:



  • Strong experience of C# .Net development

  • Developing RESTful APIs and integrating with external services

  • Experience working on large scale problems

  • Advocate of automated regression testing

  • Passion to do things the right way

  • Experience with agile methodologies and automated delivery

  • Can contribute to technical and business discussions to help shape products and roadmaps

  • Experience with geo-spatial data is a plus


More specifically:


The below is not a shopping list - but the kind of tech we use. The more you have the better it is, but the willingness to pick this stuff up (and potentially make alternative suggestions) is what we are after.



  • C# .Net, Azure, REST

  • JS / Html / Css

  • ElasticSearch, Git CLI

  • Rabbit MQ,

  • AzureServiceBus

  • Angular JS (1.6+) Or Aurelia

  • Data Ingestion & transformation

  • DDD, CQ(R)S, Event Driven Architecture

  • Message queues, MassTransit, AzureServiceBus

  • GIS, GeoJson experience

  • Microservices, SOA

  • TimeSeries Data processing

  • Regular Expressions




BENEFITS


AppyWay works hard to create an inclusive environment to be a part of. A culturally diverse workspace, but all sharing the same eye-on-the-prize mentality - but on top of that:



  • Generous Salary - £40,000-£50,000 DOE

  • Pension - we all get old. look at the CTO - we didn't know numbers went up that high!

  • Perkbox - free stuff/cheap stuff/discounted stuff - what's not to like?

  • Ability to work from home - it's where the heart is.

  • A very cool office in Farringdon - exposed brick, glass, sofas, sideboards (like the 70's)

  • Share options - If AppyWay does well, so do we all!

  • Biscuits, lots of biscuits - (and fruit) but who doesn't like the odd biscuit.


Please note, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship or relocation assistance. This role is based in our London office, and is not suitable for remote working.


By submitting your details you agree to our Candidate Privacy Policy that can be found on the following link: (https://appyway.com/candidate-privacy-policy/).

items.content:
Full Stack Principal Engineer, Start-up, London, Circa £90k (flex) + Equity Options, 90% Remote Work

A "tech for good" start-up in London is looking for a Principal Engineer to work on new greenfield projects and define the technical roadmap for the business.

Why join:

• Blank canvas! This is an early-stage start-up so you will help them choose the best tools and technologies for the job.

• Excellent flexible / remote work options available.

• Opportunity to build and scale your own team in the future.

• Work with a polyglot technical stack in a serverless environment.

The company:

This social impact business helps older generations gain access to career advice and lifestyle opportunities via their SaaS platform. It's still early days so they're looking for a Principal Engineer with good understanding of architectural design and quality-code principles to work closely with the CTO to define their technical strategy going forward. They are looking to scale with a view to building a team around you as they grow, so this is a business critical hire.

You'll be working with: C#, .Net Core, Java, Python, React / Native, AWS, MongoDB, and Big Data (although you'll have a say as to whether these technologies are a good choice or not!)

Perks:

• 90% remote work available

• £80-90k base (flex) + Equity options

• Nice office in Central London

If you would be interested in hearing more, please do get in touch.

Thanks,

Annie

items.content:
Certica Solutions

Senior Full Stack Engineer Content Software Products

We are seeking an experienced Senior Software Engineer to join the software products organization.As a member of the software products team, this role collaborates with members of the product, architecture, and dev-ops teams to design, build, test, and deploy world-class SaaS solutions to power applications in the public education sector.They will work with technology architects to transform product requirements into scalable, maintainable implementations using industry best-practices.  This individual should be a driven, self-starter, with a pragmatic approach to solving business problems using technology.  They should be comfortable working in a small, distributed team, and be an efficient and effective communicator.  This role requires strong attention to detail, and the ability to empathize with end-users to develop an appropriate technical solution.  The ideal candidate should be familiar with modern testing methodologies and possess very strong testing and debugging skills.  Essential Tasks and Responsibilities: * Design and develop product enhancements and new product functionality; *  Ensure products can operate at the necessary scale needed by customers; *  Maintain current web applications; *  Work closely with a team to integrate designs, components, and ideas together; *  Apply software development best practices for development (e.g. SOLID, Design Patterns, TDD, BDD) and configuration management tasks; * Work in an agile software development environment with distributed teams using Scrum; * Ability to constructively discuss, challenge, accept challenges from other viewpoints, and negotiate the best solution to deliver best value to the customer and time to market; *  Participate in all aspects of the product including design, development, deployment, and maintenance; and * Successfully partner with other teams, such as client services, product management, and quality assur Skills and Professional Experience:  * Full stack web-based application design and development experience; * Must have experience in the following technologies: C# and .NET, Entity Framework, build and deployment tools (with a preference for Team City and Octopus), and Git; * Strong database development skills utilizing SQL Server; * Willingness to learn multiple technologies (languages, databases, frameworks, etc.) as needed; * Strong architectural acumen with ability to visualize future state, describe how to achieve it and then implement; * Experience working with SaaS is desirable; * Experienced in developing and operating software products in a cloud-based environment is extremely desirable; * Experience with Azure is desirable and would be considered a plus; * Strong communication, analytical, entrepreneur skills with pride in personal contributions and passion to learn and grow your professional skills/experience; and * BA/BS Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related software engineering experience;

items.content:
Remote Senior F# Engineer

Company: Cazana
Type: full-time
Location: London, Europe, Remote

Cazana has been gathering a huge database of used car prices, images, mileages and hundreds of other fields over the past several years. We use them to produce car valuations, provide vehicle history checks and help dealers and insurance companies to thrive. It's an exciting time to join the business, we're growing fast on the back of epic success and we're well funded by some of London's leading VCs. It seems like every day that another massive company is signing up to use our B2B offerings (and they're house hold names, too). We are the “cool guys” shaking up an archaic industry with big data and machine learning. We have an old B2C site (cazana.com) but our ‘real’ business takes place behind closed doors (B2B) on trade.cazana.com and is only open to paying business customers.

F# experience is not necessarily required, but you should have a senior level of ability in another functional language.

Main Responsibilities:

  • Development of Data Platform (performant processing, enrichment, cleaning, etc)
  • Work on internal services like F# APIs, or lambda functions (sometimes in Python)
  • "Parenting" the internal projects: improving system observability, monitoring, automatizing repeatable tasks and optimizing existing solution.
  • Be a senior figure to less experienced team mates, answer questions and make good suggestions.
  • Refactoring, fixing bugs and performing code reviews.
  • Be able to own a task end-to-end on your own, from figuring out what is really needed all the way up to deployment – while engaging teammates for advice and to bounce ideas off along the way.
  • Support the data scientists by making sure the data is in the shape they need it to be to deliver.

We are a Big Data company first and foremost and an interest or experience in dealing with huge data sets is welcome.

Ideal candidate should:

  • Be responsible and work proactively.
  • Be persistent and care about high quality of his/her work: this includes various testing approaches (i.e. unit, integration or property-based tests), peer reviews and performance optimizations (mostly on .NET Core platform).
  • Be able to share his/her knowledge and experience with other team members.
  • Have experience with web crawling, and the nature of scraped data.
  • Have a good knowledge of functional programming (a lot of our current work is done in F#).
  • Understand event-driven architectures, streaming and actor model programming (part of the system is written in Akka.NET streams).
  • Be familiar with AWS platform.
  • Know how to automatize deployment process (defining build tasks, Infrastructure as a Code).
  • Know how to build efficient, multi-threaded and distributed systems.
  • Have general knowledge of SQL and NoSQL. Know when to use which one, based on the business needs. Experience with PostgreSQL and Elasticsearch is always welcome.

What can we offer:

  • 100% remote work: the development team embraces fully remote working practices, as we are distributed across the world. Not to say it is mandatory to be remote – we have offices in London and Bucharest. If you live in either the UK or Romania, you could consider to come to one of the offices a few days a week as suits you, or full time if it that’s what makes you happy.
  • Flat organization structure: this is not a PLC, we do not have architecture boards etc. We organize and prioritize our tasks by ourselves, according to business needs while balancing technical priorities. We choose technologies and solutions as a group. We trust our staff to do the job well without micromanaging them.
  • OSS friendliness: we use a lot of open source stuff here, and we contribute developer time to improve or fix OSS projects which help us with our goals.
  • Chance to work in polyglot environment: we have people working in F#, R, JavaScript, PHP and Python.
  • If you're a remote worker, we'll fly you into London as often as you like to spend time with us (we have beer, cake, and a very small car called Bamby in our office).
  • Minimal meetings. Aside from a brief ~15 minute breakfast meeting on a Monday to quickly fly over what’s on the agenda across the whole business for the week, there is a distinct lack of ‘formal’ meetings in place. We communicate mostly over slack, have adhoc video calls as needed, and work pretty flexible hours.

To Apply

Send email with your CV to apply-9190 [at] functionaljobs [dot] com

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=69, c=2, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=21}
items.content:
Diagram

 

Senior Web Developer

Apply your .NET skills as a lead developer within a multi-disciplinary A-team of experts. Day to day, you'll be collaboratively solving problems, architecting solutions, and expanding your mastery of CMS web development. If you are a tenacious problem-solver who thrives when digging deep into code and complex data sets, you will fit right in.    We specialize in the design and development of enterprise .NET websites, so experience working with a.NET content management system (Ektron, Episerver, Umbraco, Sitecore, etc.) is required.   STRATEGY, DESIGN, AND DEVELOPMENT AS A TEAM SPORT. When you become a Senior .NET developer at Diagram, you'll get assigned to an account team with a strategist at the helm. Each team is responsible for working with a small group of clients, understanding their business goals, and building out a strategic roadmap to help push them forward. In your role, you can expect a healthy mix of writing code, gathering requirements, participating in design critiques, architecting solutions,and coordinating with your team and clients. Each account team operates autonomously, meaning that the strategies your team propose will drive the work you do—what you can accomplish is limited only by your collective ideas and abilities.  LET’S GET TECHNICAL The incredibly complex nature of the web projects we take on demand a wide range of technical prowess from our development leads. As a DiagramSenior Developer, you'll need to demonstrate expertise in the following areas: * Programming Languages: C# * Microsoft Web Frameworks: ASP.NET, MVC, Razor, Web API * Database Solutions: SQL or TSQL * Strong understanding of core development concepts: Object-Oriented Programming (OOP), relational database concepts, Inversion of Control (IoC), and Dependency Injection (DI) * Integrating third-party solutions through Web Services or other messaging frameworks * Basic knowledge of IIS and setting up local sites * Using Git and version control * Familiarity with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, and other JavaScript frameworks A HOME FOR DEDICATED PROFESSIONALS Our organizational model involves building out small collaborative teams that kick ass. If you work best when you're handed a blueprint and left alone to build in solitude for weeks on end, you might not be a good fit. Diagram developers prefer to be in the mix of things and would rather contribute to solving real problems with code than to just take orders. You are naturally curious, eager to learn, and play nice with others. As a developer at Diagram, you are treated as a professional, working with other professionals for common goals.Day to day, some of your responsibilities will include: * Work with modern hosting technologies: Azure DevOps, CI/CD, AWS, Episerver DXC, Umbraco Cloud * Analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve issues on enterprise client websites * Adapt to and learn new and emerging .NET/CMS technologies * Communicate and convey technical concepts to clients, team members, and project managers * Contribute to functional requirements and technical documentation * Work both independently as well as collaboratively within a team * Propose and architect technical solutions that help drive our clients forward * Estimate effort for development tasks WORKING AT DIAGRAM Diagram is a digital consultancy focused on design, development and marketing. We work with a small, exclusive set of client partners. It’s our goal to help them grow by developing strategic digital roadmaps and executing on it. We have a distributed team, with the bulk of our team based in Aurora, IL. We also have co-working space available in Fulton Market. We’ve been around since 1995. We're a fun, committed group of professionals dedicated to helping each team member produce the best work of their lives. We also offer great health benefits, a 401k plan with company matching, free lunches on Wednesdays, and other sweet perks. CROSS-FUNCTIONAL TEAMS No more hand-offs. Work collaboratively as part of one of our multidisciplinary teams. You’ll be contributing to ideation and decisions at all stages, actively shaping the design of everything you work on. OPEN PTO POLICY We respect work-life balance and recognize that flexibility is key. Coordinate within your team, keep up with your work, take time off when you need it. We don't restrict or limit the amount of time off team members take. 'Nuff said. CHALLENGING WORK We thrive when data is messy, problems are complex, and innovation is needed. We strive to push boundaries and continually ship value for a limited number of retainer clients. We're not a one and done shop. We value long-term client partnerships and iterative improvement. Interested in becoming a part of a world-class team at Diagram? To Apply: To apply for this position, please send something that you feel communicates your expertise and what you're all about. This could be a resume, a portfolio site, or something entirely unexpected. You decide.

items.content:
Avanti Recruitment are partnered with a company near Wokingham expanding their company and .Net development team (currently 11 developers plus the development manager). It is a relatively small company, privately owned and making big moves in their industry (travel). They are looking for a .Net Developer (£50-65k).

Most people work up to 4 days a week at home, and the rest of the time they are in the office not far from Wokingham. It's a small team so this isn't suited to anyone who wants to be anonymous. On the other side of this you'll be close to decision making and you will be in an environment where careers grow quickly.

The tech is C#, WebAPI, .Net CORE, Service Fabric, Kubernetes, containerisation, Cosmos and loads of Azure - service fabris, message queuing. Also LLBLGen (an ORM), Autofoc for IoC and design patterns, as well as Aurelia and TypeScript.

There's a big focus on clean, good quality code so if that's you, apply now!

If this company is of interest apply now or get in touch with Travis Kennard.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=1, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Company Information
Solid reputation, passionate people and endless opportunities. That's Travelers. Our superior financial strength and consistent record of strong operating returns mean security for our customers - and opportunities for our employees. You will find Travelers to be full of energy and a workplace in which you truly can make a difference.

Job Summary
Travelers is looking for energetic, creative and talented people to join our Sales Enablement technology team, powered by the Salesforce platform. You will be responsible for the design, development, testing and implementation of all components of our Salesforce implementations. You will work with a team of talented engineers and contributors from across the company to enable effective and scalable solutions that will be leveraged by thousands of Travelers personnel. Working within an agile delivery model, this team will have a profound effect on driving efficiencies, increasing revenue and enabling a strategic technical foundation for the future. You will work with Salesforce capabilities including Lightning, Financial Services Cloud, and expansion into our growing portfolio of Salesforce Cloud technologies.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities
  • Develop, implement and maintain standard configuration and customizations using APEX, VisualForce, Lightning Components and JavaScript
  • Integrate Salesforce platform with source applications using defined integration patterns to ensure production readiness and an outstanding user experience
  • Participate in agile delivery activities such as design, estimating, retrospectives and continuous improvement
  • Create and execute test scripts for assigned development work
  • Ensure availability of the Salesforce platform and provide on-call support to resolve application issues when necessary
  • This position is open for candidates to work remotely.


Minimum Qualifications
A bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field, or its equivalent in work experience, and five years of programming/development experience.

Education, Work Experience & Knowledge
  • 3 years or more as a Salesforce Developer (APEX, VisualForce, Lightning) is required
  • Experience in Salesforce CRM integration, developing and deploying custom integration solutions using APIs and API management systems is desirable
  • Proficiency with Data tools (SQL Server, SQL, ETL, Dataloader, etc.) is desirable
  • Experience working as a team member in an Agile delivery model
  • Working knowledge of test automation tools like Selenium
  • Working knowledge of CA Agile Manager (Rally) or similar ALM tools
  • Working knowledge of automated deployment / DevOps tools and technologies
  • Working knowledge of source control management tools such as Git


Job Specific & Technical Skills & Competencies
Technical Knowledge: Able to expertly assess, design develop, and support applications, systems and solutions to achieve business and/or technical requirements. Demonstrates technical expertise for multiple languages, applications, systems, technologies, and/or frameworks, and has the ability to influence technical direction or defect resolution. Fully understands business applications and/or technical system environments in which the system operates.
Communication Skills: Ability to communicate thoughts/designs/ideas in an unambiguous manner and adjusts communication based on audience. Exhibits active and effective communication skills with team members - including active listening and effective written and verbal communication skills. Effectively contributes and communicates with the immediate team. Able to present complex technical concepts to audiences of varying size and level.
Business Knowledge & Partnership: Able to develop business partnerships and influence business priorities through solution identification aligned with business objectives and goals. Able to communicate in business terms and describe IT capabilities and concepts in ways that the business can understand.
Problem Solving & Decision Making: Able to proficiently diagnose root causes and solve complex problems. Able to evaluate alternative solutions and assess risk before taking action. Has the ability to reach sound decisions quickly and escalates appropriately. Demonstrates ability to optimize the use of all available resources.
Team Orientation: Able to maintain and enhance partnerships across the organization to achieve objectives. Practices objectivity and openness to others' views. Able to recognize and support team priorities.
Leadership: Accountable to set technical goals and priorities for self and other team members. Exhibits team leadership and collaborates with partners.
Planning and Project Management: Demonstrates ability to identify critical project tasks and establish clear priorities while keeping the bigger picture in mind. Able to effectively collaborate with Project Manager and utilize sound project management practices. Able to manage time and competing priorities.
Financial Awareness: Able to assess the financial impact of recommended designs/solutions.

Environmental/Work Schedules/Other
  • This position is open for candidates to work remotely.
  • Requires occasional weekend and/or overnight work hours.
  • Requires periods (1 or more weeks) of travel as needed.
  • Requires travel up to 5% of the time.


Physical Requirements
Operates standard office equipment. Requires extended periods of computer use. Requires extended periods of sitting.

Licensing or Certificates
  • Salesforce.com certifications such as Certified Platform Developer I, Certified Platform Developer II are strongly preferred
  • Remain current with Salesforce technologies and best practices, including Salesforce certifications as appropriate


Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
Travelers is an equal opportunity employer.

Company Information

Our superior financial strength and consistent record of strong operating returns mean security for our customers - and opportunities for our employees. You will find Travelers to be full of energy and a workplace in which you truly can make a difference.

Job Summary
Travelers Claim Technology is currently seeking an experienced Sr Intelligent Capture (IC) Software Developer to join a brand new IC Team! Here is a rare opportunity to get into a group on the 'ground floor' and help lead the way we deliver cutting edge Intelligent Capture solutions to our business areas. If you have a passion for technology and staying current with industry trends, then read further - this is the role for you!

Marketing Description
Will consider option to work Remote from home office for right candidate.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities
The Senior IC Software Developer will be responsible for executing business projects to automate new or existing processes using common IC tools like Kofax Total Agility. The ideal candidate for this position will have the skills and experience necessary to:
  • Analyze business problems, design technology solutions to these problems and manage the solution through the full life-cycle.
  • Design & Develop IC solutions when needed, exceeding business expectations
  • Design & Develop reusable components, frameworks and libraries
  • Participate in process reengineering efforts
  • Partner with IC Engineers in Unit Testing, support Systems Integration testing and UAT
  • Partner with architecture team to adhere IC Team to best practices for implementing IC solutions
  • Works in collaboration with projects teams to develop, test, implement and support solutions using IC platforms.
  • Responsible for ensuring an efficient integration of programming deliverables, timely builds and overall code quality
  • Educate business teams on value proposition for IC and educate IC Team on development best practices
  • Become IC Champion for Claim Technology
  • Build lasting partnerships with Technology and Business Team
  • Lead and mentor IC Engineers


Minimum Qualifications
A bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field, or its equivalent in work experience, and five years of programming/development experience.

Education, Work Experience & Knowledge
  • 2 or more years hands on IC development experience preferred
  • Experience with Agile Frameworks, preferably Scrum and/or SAFe


Job Specific & Technical Skills & Competencies
  • General programming and development proficiencies (.NET, C#, C++, Web Services, HTML, PCF, etc).
  • SQL, MongoDB and other database knowledge
  • Prefer Kofax Total Agility or other enterprise document capture applications
  • Kofax Capture API
  • KTA or Kofax Capture Certifications a plus
  • Python


Environmental/Work Schedules/Other
Requires weekend work hours. Requires overnight work hours. Requires holiday work hours (Federal and religious). Requires extended periods (1 or more weeks) of travel as needed. Requires travel up to 5% of time.

Physical Requirements
Operates standard office equipment. Requires extended periods of computer use. Requires extended periods of sitting.

Licensing or Certificates
Depends on the specific role but some examples may include: ITIL Remedy Java certification Microsoft certification.net Kanban/Agile/SAFe

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
Travelers is an equal opportunity employer.

Sage Publishing

 

Lead Development Engineer .net Core


United Kingdom
Gvpi is a Division of Sage Publishing, A leading global E-content and publisher of digital textbooks and Academic content based in the US. Gvpi are a truly remote company, based across the US and Canada but would like to hire a UK based individual to join the team who can work with their UK/Sage product team to build new publishing platforms. The role would involve being fully remote, could potentially help build a new team remotely in the UK and report directly to the CEO/President of Gvpi in the US, working with their engineers there. This would be a full time role, with the opportunity to travel to our Birmingham and London offices at times, when needed. # Responsibilities Work as part of the global Gvpi engineering team to architect and build new systems. This includes developing systems and functions such as: content delivery web sites, content loading, access control, reporting, analytics and other publishing related tools and controls. # Requirements Heavy experience in .NET, specifically C# and MVC, in regard to building web sites Experience in .NET Core a plus Heavy experience in Microsoft SQL Server Heavy experience with JavaScript Good communication skills, willing to be part of a team Experience working remotely from home a plus (needs to be self-motivated and know how to work efficiently when not in the same office) Experience with publishing a plus Years of experience in an agile environment (Scrum, Kanban) a plus Experience with building accessible sites a plus Experience with Azure DevOps a plus #Salary 80000 US Dollars #Location - United Kingdom

items.content: Job title: IT Application Management Analyst- 100% remote (556495) Location: 100% remote, Austin, TX Duration: 3 Months Position Description: Looking for IT Application Management Analysts with SAP migration experience. Virtustream is Dell Technologies' enterprise-class cloud company, delivering IaaS and Application Managed Services across the commercial, government and healthcare sectors, both through direct customer engagements and through our partner ecosystem. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: SAP migration experience. Advanced Trouble shooting skills in SAP System Administration, SAP Netweaver Administration. SAP Netweaver Technical certification preferred. Experience with HANA and/or S/4HANA systems Administration and Upgrades. Expert Knowledge of SAP system installation, configuration, maintenance, migrations and upgrades. Hands-on SAP BASIS troubleshooting experience in multiple SAP components like ECC,BW,CRM,XI/PI/PO, Solman, NW Gateway, Fiori, SAP HANA and other databases. Experience with performance measuring and monitoring of SAP systems. Hands On and Expert Knowledge in configuring and Administering SOLMAN. Hands On and Expert Knowledge in Administering Oracle and ASE. Hands on Experience in troubleshooting the 3rd Party tools with SAP. Expert knowledge and Hands on Experience in SAP Refresh Procedures using LAMA/Libelle tool. SAP Application support experience, preferably in outsourced environments. Strong working knowledge of operating systems (e.g./Linux & Windows) and relational databases. Ability to conduct research into and troubleshoot all SAP application issues. Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.

items.title: Engineering Manager Developer Support
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=9, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Olo

Engineering Manager Developer Support

At Olo we develop an online food ordering platform used by many of the country’s largest restaurant chains, reaching millions of consumers. Chances are if you’ve ordered directly from a restaurant brand’s app or website, we’ve made that happen. Mobile ordering and payments is an exciting and active industry full of interesting players and yet still a relatively untapped market ripe for disruption. We’re quite up-front about the technical challenges our business faces. Running a platform with multiple white-labeled front-ends, that maintains real-time connections into thousands of restaurants’ POS systems, and coordinates complex transactions between these and other third parties (such as payment gateways and gift card providers) is not for the faint of heart! The Developer Support engineering team at Olo supports our partners in their efforts to integrate with our platform. Whether it be an agency building bespoke web and mobile ordering apps for our restaurant brands, a restaurant marketplace integrating to our platform to gain access to Olo customer restaurants, restaurant technology partners building POS or loyalty platform integrations, or a third party ordering platform provider who is building a delivery capability via Olo’s Dispatch delivery brokerage service, third party developers are key components of Olo’s success. The Olo Developer Support team consults with third party developers to educate them on our APIs, investigates problems reported by partners during their integration and certification, provides timely responses to questions during an integration project, facilitates access to test environments as well as our production environment, develops ongoing improvements to the Developer Portal web application that is used by partners to gain access to API documentation and manage API keys, and provides API documentation updates as needed. As Engineering Manager, you will lead a team of talented developer support engineers in their efforts to deliver an exceptional integration experience to our technology partners.  At Olo we value outcomes over output, and seek a leader who can help us understand the broader needs of our partners and deliver the support, tooling, and documentation necessary to meet those needs. You will help develop and align the team’s vision, guide their execution, remove impediments to the team’s progress, and coach them to develop and grow both their skills and impactfulness. You will foster a culture of collaboration, communication, accountability, skill sharing, belonging, mutual respect, and curiosity. We expect our Engineering Managers to be seasoned engineers with the technical experience to both guide and challenge their teams. As a servant leader, your focus will be on facilitating strong team outcomes, hiring and developing engineering talent, and ensuring that we are delivering an exceptional service to our technology partners. While your primary focus will not be one of designing and developing software, we expect our engineering managers to have a strong software development foundation to be able to effectively guide their teams. As such we expect you to have demonstrable experience in software development that spans architecture and design, coding, quality best practices, and production operational concerns. Our technology stack is rooted in .NET and SQL Server running in an AWS infrastructure, and we leverage modern software engineering tools such as GitHub, TeamCity, Octopus Deploy, Datadog, and Sumo Logic, as well as heavy use of OSS. This is a full-time position. Candidates may work at Olo’s headquarters in New York City’s Financial District, or remotely from anywhere in the U.S. In fact, more than 75% of our engineering team is remote! Desired Experience * A  passion for computing that extends beyond work * At least 8 years of software development experience with a progression to a senior technical level * At least 2 years of engineering management experience under an Agile operational model * Demonstrated ability to build and mentor a high performance team while seeking continuous improvement * Ability to translate business priorities into viable technology or process solutions, and deliver * Experience developing realistic project plans, managing stakeholder expectations, and tracking team execution * Adept at writing unit tests and testable code, and working under distributed version control (preferably Git) * Experience managing distributed teams consisting largely of remote engineers * BS degree in a technical field of study, or equivalent practical experience * Excellent English writing and verbal communication skills * Legal right to work in the U.S. Beneficial Experience * Experience in a technical support or developer support role * Experience with technical writing in a software environment About Olo Olo is the on-demand interface for the restaurant industry, powering digital ordering and delivery for over 300 restaurant brands across 70,000 locations. Olo’s enterprise-grade software powers every stage of the digital restaurant transaction, from fully-branded guest interfaces to the back-of-house order management features that keep the kitchen running smoothly. Orders from Olo are injected seamlessly into existing restaurant systems to help brands capture demand from on-demand channels such as branded websites and apps, third-party marketplaces, social media channels, and personal assistant devices like the Amazon Echo. Olo is a pioneer in the industry, beginning with text message ordering on mobile feature phones in 2005. Today, over 100 million consumers use Olo to order ahead or get meals delivered from the restaurants they love. Customers include Applebee’s (DIN), Chili’s (EAT), Denny’s (DENN), Five Guys Burgers & Fries, Jamba Juice (JMBA), Noodles & Company (NDLS), Red Robin (RRGB), Shake Shack (SHAK), sweetgreen, Wingstop (WING), and more. SKIP THE LINE® You can work at Olo’s headquarterson the 82nd floor of One World Trade Center or remotely from anywhere in the U.S. In fact, more than two-thirds of our engineering team is remote! We offer great benefits, such as 20 days of Paid Time Off, fully paid health, dental and vision care premiums, stock options, a generous parental leave plan, and perks like FitBits, rotating craft beers on tap in our kitchen, and food events featuring our clients' menu items (now you know why we give out FitBits!). Check out our culture map:https://www.olo.com/images/culture.jpg. We encourage you to apply!  At Olo, we know a diverse and inclusive team not only makes our products better, but our workplace better. Many groups are consistently underrepresented across the tech sector and we are fully committed to doing our part to move the needle.  Olo is an equal opportunity employer and diversity is highly valued at our company. All applicants receive consideration for employment. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If you like what you read, hear, and/or know about Olo, and want to be a part of our team, please do not hesitate to apply! We are excited to hear from you!

We're quite up-front about the technical challenges our business faces. Our platform enables multiple white-labeled front-ends, maintains real-time connections into thousands of restaurants' POS systems, and coordinates complex transactions between these and other third parties (such as payment gateways and gift card providers). Running such a platform is not for the faint of heart.

Mobile ordering and payments is an exciting and active industry, full of interesting players and yet still a relatively untapped market ripe for disruption. 

We have a relatively small team of smart, senior engineers who all get along. 

We're super DevOps oriented and like to automate and build tools for everything. We use Continuous Integration and push frequently. 

We dedicate time to refactoring to reduce technical debt and to introduce newer technologies. We encourage new ideas and experimentation. No part of the codebase is off-limits.

Came here for the pizza coding test? Check out our open jobs and we'll send you the test post-application!

Benefits

  • 20 Days of PTO
  • Health, Vision & Dental coverage (you + your family)
  • Flexible working hours
  • Competitive Compensation Package
  • Powerful workstations
  • 401(k) Plan
  • Maximum respect
  • Food events & monthly team events
  • 12 week paid parental leave

Badass Software Agency Seeks Awesome C# Engineer

 
About Us:
We are searching to partner with someone knowledgeable to work alongside our team. We are a small shop based in New York. We work entirely remotely and strive to maintain a personal, flexible, but also fast paced work environment. We have a strong belief in remote culture and agile development. Our goal is to provide top quality work for clients. We work on an extremely wide variety of projects. 

About Our Technologies:
We believe in using the right tool for the job. We work in modern technology stacks like Node, Rails, Python, React Native, and many more. For this particular project, we’re searching for someone who can work effectively in C# with Xamarin & .NET


We are looking for a contractor who:
  • Takes responsibility for and drives projects where appropriate
  • Will work with our experienced development team to produce high quality solutions
  • Will work directly with our client, who will be interacting with your work daily
  • Communicates openly and often, using tools such as Slack


About You:
  • Strong experience with Xamarin apps & .NET backends
  • Able to integrate yourself into the client’s development lifecycle
  • Thrive in a dynamic environment where we embrace change
  • Think deeply and enthusiastically about software as a finished product; take pride in your work!

IT Specialist (f/m/x) // Finiata

Company: Finiata

Tags:
  • Networking
  • DevOps
  • system administration
  • Shell Scripting
  • Infrastructure
  • Active Directory
  • TCP/IP
  • it-support
  • Identity management
  • Mobile Device Management
  • Radius
  • TechOps
  • network administration
  • IT Help Desk
  • Systems & Networks Administration
  • Windows System Administration

    • ABOUT US

    As one of the fastest-growing FinTech companies in Europe, Finiata is an exciting place to work. We are determined to help small businesses and freelancers in Europe to focus on what really matters – saving them time, stress and money by providing accessible and seamless financing and cash flow solutions.

    In less than 2 years, Finiata has raised more than €23 million from top European investors. This has been possible by focusing on long-term customer needs and providing the best solutions based on real customer feedback.

    Setting business up for success is Finiata’s reason for existence. Our easy-to-use Finiata App enables businesses to receive working-capital, credited to their bank account within 15 minutes, resolving the struggle for liquidity without any credit history or complicated forms.

    Finiata is filled with curious people who want to learn while having fun. Our diverse team of 60 talents from 19 nations is located across three locations in Germany, Poland, and Ukraine. We appreciate the power of diversity and share a passion for product development and creating exceptional user experiences that have a real impact on our customers’ lives. Join a fast-growing company of smart and ambitious people to support more than 1 million small businesses over the next 5 years!

    YOUR MISSION

    • Managing our office network infrastructure (Firewall configuration with Sophos UTM, Wifi/Radius, Ethernet, Switches, etc.)
    • Taking over ownership of the employee device management (Windows, Mac, Linux) and the procurement of laptop hardware and accessories
    • Setting up accounts and workstations (onboarding and offboarding)
    • Managing and assuring the quality of our IDM system
    • Troubleshooting issues and outages as well as taking over IT support and helpdesk tasks
    • Taking over configuration and Quality Assurance of our VOIP infrastructure

    YOUR PROFILE

    • Professional education as IT specialist (System Integration)
    • Strong skills in administrating Windows/Linux/macOS machines
    • Experience in OS security (Firewall rules, Design and Implementation of ACLs)
    • Experience in working with an IDM, LDAP or Active Directory system
    • Knowledge of one or more scripting language (Python, Bash, PowerShell or similar)
    • Understanding of Network protocols, e.g. TCP/IP, ICMP, Ethernet, Wireless Networking Standards and Wireless Security
    • Fluent in spoken and written English
    • Resourcefulness and problem-solving attitude
    • Strong interest in security and user focus

    WHY US?

    • Get to make an impact on thousands of businesses every day
    • Be paid a competitive salary with stock options
    • Participate in a self-organized, continuously improving team
    • Work with the best and learn from other competent and brilliant people
    • Be supported to grow and take leadership from day one
    • Get insights and learnings about the financial business and technology
    • Benefit from remote work opportunities and flexible working hours
    • Benefit from an office in the centre of Berlin with great perks (Free drinks and fresh fruit, Urban Sports Club membership, Pizza Thursday)
    • Have the option to take German language courses
    • Have the option to bring your best buddy to work. We love dogs
    Apply for this position

items.content:
ToGo Technology

 

Senior Asp.net MVC Angular Developer

ToGo Technologies is looking to add a creative and motivated developer to join our team. If you enjoy working in a Start-Up environment, but don’t want the stress of worrying about your next paycheck, ToGo is the perfect place for someone like you. ToGo is a well-established and successful technology company focusing on providing tools and software for online restaurant ordering. You will play a key role in expanding our capabilities and partnerships. We are always looking for the best people, and as such, this is a 100% remote position. Work from home, your favorite coffee shop or from wherever you are most comfortable. ToGo has employees in the following cities: * Las Vegas, Nevada * Nashville, Tennessee By no means are you required to live in or relocate to any of these locations but if you live in or nearby, we would love to see you for the occasional lunch gathering. Skills & Requirements We expect to see: * Solid programming skills and a track record of getting things done. * An autonomous, self-driven, and positive attitude. * Strong C#, ASP.Net/MVC skills * 2+ years of experience with MSSQL and or Entity Framework * 2+ years experience with Angular.js * 2+ years of experience in production environments where scale, stability, and performance matter. * Excellent communication skills (written and spoken). * A love for technology and learning new things. We like to see (but not required): * Knowledge of Postgres, ASP.Net Core * Experience with continuous deployment. * Open source involvement and visible code that you are proud of. * Active accounts in online technical communities (StackOverflow, GitHub, etc…).

items.content:
Keytree is currently recruiting for an experienced Full Stack .NET Developer with strong experience using JavaScript and frameworks such as Angular.js and React.js to join their Managed Services team. As part of the role you will work on the build and maintenance of custom web applications for a number of high-profile end clients.

You will work as part of a project team collaborating with other team members and the client where required, to deliver against an agreed design specification, timescale and to budget.

At Keytree we are passionate about our products and the evolving technologies we use to build them. The Full Stack .NET Developer will need to share our passion for craftsmanship in software design and development and continuous improvement in the techniques, tools and languages we use; as well as have an appreciation for business objectives and delivering superior, innovative software solutions.

Required Skills:
  • Minimum of 3 years commercial experience with .NET 4.0/4.5
  • .NET web application experience (MVC, ASP.NET, C#, LINQ)
  • Experience developing office applications using VSTO
  • Strong Front End development experience (HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript/jQuery)
  • JavaScript Framework experience- Angular.js or React.js
  • MS SQL Server
  • Git or SVN
  • RESTful APIs
  • Strong understanding of cross-browser compatibility
  • Agile/Scrum methodology experience
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Clear communication skills
Desirable Skills:
  • Experience of developing for cloud computing platforms including AWS and Azure
  • Java development experience
The ideal candidate should have a proven track record within a commercial project environment and a keen interest in the latest technologies and development techniques, which will be beneficial in influencing the technologies, and best practices across our client base. It's essential that you are able to work collaboratively as well as autonomously when necessary.

This is a permanent opportunity based in our Port Talbot, Wales office with the opportunity for some remote work.

Keytree is offering a highly competitive salary plus benefits as well as excellent opportunities for professional development.

We do not accept applications from Agencies or other 3rd Parties.
Port Talbot

Job description

ToGo Technologies is looking to add a creative and motivated developer to join our team. If you enjoy working in a Start-Up environment, but don’t want the stress of worrying about your next paycheck, ToGo is the perfect place for someone like you. ToGo is a well-established and successful technology company focusing on providing tools and software for online restaurant ordering. You will play a key role in expanding our capabilities and partnerships.

We are always looking for the best people, and as such, this is a 100% remote position. Work from home, your favorite coffee shop or from wherever you are most comfortable. ToGo has employees in the following cities:

  • Las Vegas, Nevada
  • Nashville, Tennessee

By no means are you required to live in or relocate to any of these locations but if you live in or nearby, we would love to see you for the occasional lunch gathering.

Skills & Requirements

We expect to see:

  • Solid programming skills and a track record of getting things done.
  • An autonomous, self-driven, and positive attitude.
  • Strong C#, ASP.Net/MVC skills
  • 2+ years of experience with MSSQL and or Entity Framework
  • 2+ years experience with Angular.js
  • 2+ years of experience in production environments where scale, stability, and performance matter.
  • Excellent communication skills (written and spoken).
  • A love for technology and learning new things.

We like to see (but not required):

  • Knowledge of Postgres, ASP.Net Core
  • Experience with continuous deployment.
  • Open source involvement and visible code that you are proud of.
  • Active accounts in online technical communities (StackOverflow, GitHub, etc…).
Apply now

About ToGo Technology

Our team has the privilege of working in a Start Up environment in an established company, never having to worry about the dreaded layoff.  Always experimenting and evaluating emergent technologies, we are always looking to add talented developers to our team.

Benefits

  • 100% Remote, work from where you want within the United States
  • Small, fast moving team, no paralysis by analysis
  • Start Up environment (But established, stable business)
  • Health/Dental/Vision plan

items.content:
Software Application Support Developer at Sealaska

Remote | Entry-level

City

Virtual – USA

Job ID

2019-2219

Overview

Managed Business Solutions is seeking a Software Application Support Developer to provide operations and maintenance support for enterprise application solutions. The Software Applications Support Developer will perform troubleshooting, root cause analysis, code fixes, and software enhancements for existing production applications. This is a telecommuting (virtual) role.

Responsibilities

Technical Responsibilities

  • Front-end and mid-tier focus along with server-side development in combination of new builds and legacy applications
  • Develop application requiring knowledge of JavaScript and related libraries (React, Angular, etc.), and use of Node.js and relevant managers
  • Perform server-side development using, .Net, .Net Core
  • Utilize ORMs such as Entity Framework (code-first),
  • Utilize relational databases (SQL Server, Oracle, etc.) on back-end
  • Implement user interfaces using good usability and user experience practices

Task Responsibilities

  • Troubleshoot system performance and resolving complex technology issues
  • Implement technical improvements, knowledge, and process improvements through trend and root cause analysis
  • Manage application availability, reliability, serviceability and maintainability
  • Ensure compliance to audit and security standards and guidelines
  • Review documentation for accuracy and completeness, and updating documentation for any needed changes, additions or deletions.
  • Participate in requirements definition to ensure development team has all necessary information
  • Participate in an Agile project team (and help provide input on planning)
  • Support multiple project/client needs as needed to stay aware of team needs, upcoming schedules, long-term support and new build processes in support of our federal, state government and commercial clients
  • Suggest and explore new tools to improve processes

Qualifications

Technical Qualifications

  • Expertise working with JavaScript, HTML5, CSS
  • Experience working in an Agile Environment
  • 3 to 5 years in software development/software maintenance with focus on front-end development with mix of mid-tier applications
  • Experience using C#, ASP.Net within MVC framework, Entity Framework
  • Working knowledge of version control and Continuous Integration within (Git, TFS, Jenkins).
  • Implement provided UX designs

Other Qualifications

  • Must work well in a collaborative team environment and be flexible as workloads and priorities change
  • Must be self-aware, motivated, and capable of working remotely, able to define and solve problems
  • Must excel at communication, both face-to-face and electronic
  • Should have a growth mindset to approach new technologies and new customer needs
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field preferred

Desired Skills:

  • Understanding of GIS, ESRI
  • Understanding of Cloud development (Azure, AWS)
  • Understanding of 508 compliance, WCAG 1.0-2.0, etc.
  • Awareness of SQL Reporting Services (SSRS), Business Intelligence concepts
  • Experience developing web sites for mobile devices and using various mobile frameworks

Environment (Working conditions, physical requirements):

  • This position will require moving of up to 10 lbs. This position will be mostly stationary requiring some movement around the office and frequent communication with others. The average working hours will be 8 hours per day for this position with occasional need to exceed.
  • To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable Accommodations will be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  • EOE M/F/D/V/SO
Apply for job

Zenput | San Francisco, CA USA or Remote (EU/USA) | Full-time | Software Engineer, Staff Software Engineer | ONSITE or REMOTE | $80k-$175k + equity (depends on location/role)

We’re changing the way restaurants and other retail chain operators like Dominos, Chipotle, KFC, Jersey Mike’s, and 7-Eleven translate operations strategy into great customer experiences. Today we have customers who are collectively overseeing 40,000 locations across 35+ countries using our mobile platform to drive operations excellence across all their stores.

We're looking to expand our team of experienced software engineers to help us bring a number of new capabilities to market from advanced prediction to IoT and computer vision. Our stack is based on a service oriented architecture, so we have a number of different technologies at play. To begin with, you'll be working with Python (Django), JS/Typescript (React) as well as many other tools.

Love to chat stack, so if you're interested - reach out!

More about us: https://www.zenput.com

If you're interested, email me at timols(at )zenput( dot)com and/or apply directly at https://jobs.lever.co/zenput/. No recruiters please!

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=42, c=4, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=10, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=26}
items.content:
ColibriGroup | Software Engineer | REMOTE (USA / Mexico)

Colibri Group is a family of brands (McKissock, Elite, Advance Healthcare, Western Healthcare, Real Estate Express, Superior School of Real Estate, Allied Schools, The Institute for Luxury Home Marketing, XCEL Testing Solution, and Securities Training Corporation) that provide learning solutions for licensed professionals in over 20 fields, including real estate, property appraisal, engineering, nursing, social work, massage therapy and cosmetology. Our companies are taking mandated professional education to the next level as we produce tools, courses, and job aides that help customers achieve more in their days and their careers. We help professionals become licensed, stay licensed and gain the skills to perform at the top of their fields.

Essential Skillset: TypeScript, Angular 6+, Unit Testing (Jasmine/Karma), Experience consuming APIs. GitNice to have: Knowledge of relational databases and SQL .NET / C#

What You’ll Do: As a Software Engineer, you’ll play a key role in building and testing new features and frameworks for supporting an ecosystem of common web applications used by many subsidiaries within the Colibri Group family of companies. You’ll work as a member of the technology team to collaborate with UX, product management, QA and other software engineers to define new features, estimate and implement them. Your main duties will start within the TypeScript/Angular framework, which will be consuming a .NET API, which you will have the opportunity to work on as well. In addition to creating tests with Jasmine/Karma and completing peer reviewed pull request into our production environment.

Responsibilities: We practice continuous delivery and work in an agile environment. You'll design and implement critical elements of architecture and application components for common offerings. The ideal applicant pays close attention to detail, is inquisitive, able to be self-directed while open to collaboration. We follow an unapologetic “no ego” release process where fellow engineers input opinions and suggestions on the code you would like to release to production, thereby attempting to ensure the highest quality code is released. You’ll be working on a team that owns the code from development through release into production, for multiple applications, deploying a DevOps model of complete ownership.

A bit more about the position: The position will involve support of several of our web applications. Foremost among these would be the customer dashboard. Our dashboard is setup to serve our different subsidiary companies with the same set of code. It is angular, with a dash of ionic (which we have been slowly moving away from while staying committed to angular.) The dashboard is actively developed with 11,000 commits over the last two years. As a developer on the membership/mobile team we are concentrating on improving our customers membership experience by adding and improving features to the dashboard. Other applications you will have the opportunity to interact with are a c#.net api application, a .net student course runner application as well as older .net internal applications.

We run in an agile pattern with two week sprints, story point estimating, daily zoom standups, and sprint retrospectives. Our sprint planning meetings typical have developers discussing what the highest priority is with direction from the product owner and divvying up the sprint work as the developers see fit. The position is 100% remote, with the occasional in person all engineering meetings which occur for a few days every year or two. We have typically had new developers on the team spend a sprint working on improving test coverage as it allows them to get into the code and understand the code base.

Interested in this job? Please apply here: https://www.colibrigroup.com/about-us/careers/

items.content:
Doctype | Software engineer with reverse engineering skills / Anti-cheat engineer | Stockholm, Sweden | ONSITE, VISA or REMOTE (worldwide) | Full-time | https://www.doctype.se/

We're a small digital agency based in Stockholm, Sweden. Currently around 15 people. We have an office in the heart of Stockholm, but our employees are free to work from wherever they feel most productive. We've built https://lemondogs.com/, https://www.gothiaecup.com/, https://beta.esportal.se/, amongst other websites. Our largest clients are within the eSports segment.

We’re currently looking for a software engineer with reverse engineering skills to work with us on client-sided anti-cheat technology. Our current tech stack is mainly Go, MariaDB and React, but the project you would be working on is a standalone client built in C/C++, Go and Assembly.

Requirements:

* Good understanding of C and x86-64 assembly

* Good understanding of the x86 architecture

* Good understanding of the Windows NT kernel

* Good grasp of reverse engineering

* Eager to learn

Nice to have:

* Experience with reverse engineering malware/cheats/games, the windows NT kernel

* Experience with binary instrumentation

* Experience with hardware-assisted virtualization (such as VT-x and AMD-V), SLAT (Second Level Address Translation) (e.g. EPT, NPT)

* Understanding cryptography primitives

The role we’re looking to fill is full-time. You’ll be working together with another anti-cheat engineer to combat cheaters in video games. We can offer relocation to Sweden and assist with housing.Feel free to mail me at asamy@doctype.se if this sounds interesting to you!

items.content:
Here at Situ we are creating imaginative places set to change how people discover innovative products and services from the world’s leading brands.


We are just at the start of our journey and the path ahead will be exhilarating as we get ready to open our first venue in central London.


Our tech team who are creating our inspiring platform need some additional support and so we are now looking for a home-based C# developer who lives within commutable distance of the Manchester area. The role is permanent but contract may be considered for the right candidate.


This would suit someone looking to utilise their skills and further develop their career. Working within a small but highly technical team of system architects and developers you will help build and support the company software platform.


Role Activities:



  • Help design, document and plan n-tiered applications

  • Creation of user requirement definitions and specifications, detailed documentation and system architecture diagrams.

  • Use of Agile software methodology to break requirements down into manageable “tasks” for the development team.

  • Working within the team to assist in the creation of new applications and services written in modern technologies of RESTful Web API’s, microservices and other Web based systems.

  • Analysis of performance and improvement of all key services.

  • Advise and lead the team in new development tools, techniques and technologies.

  • Support and mentor development team members in coding practices and standards.

  • Provide knowledge and experience to the company on available technologies.


Requirements & Experience:



  • 5+ years’ experience developing within a C# .NET environment.

  • 5+ years’ experience of SQL writing and general database designs.

  • A good understanding of design patterns.

  • A good understanding of best practices such as Inversion of Control and Dependency Injection.

  • A good understanding of OAuth2, OpenID and IndentityServer4.

  • Experienced in setting up Azure services.

  • Experience of leading a team of developers.


If this all sounds exciting and you feel ready for the challenge of joining a start-up organisation, then we would be delighted to receive your cv.

items.content:
As a Software Engineer at Hire Space you are responsible for an infrastructure used by millions of people.


You'll be working across the full stack, predominantly on the back end of our core app at hirespace.com. This includes multiple sets of APIs and MVC projects. You'll be exposed to a variety of technologies and will have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop new skills.


The role also involves contributing to the team through code review, participation in retrospectives and contributing to architecture planning.

Must have skills:


  • 4 years of experience of building apps using ASP.NET and C#

  • Passionate about software engineering with an awareness of various technologies across the stack

  • Understanding of the importance of building reliable, well-tested systems

  • Experience working in a professional software development team



Nice to have skills:


  • Experience of agile with Jira and Git

  • Front end experience using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML

  • Knowledge of Azure and Elastic Search

  • Dev Ops experience with Team City and Octopus

  • Computer Science degree, or equivalent



Benefits:
Not only do we offer a competitive salary but we also believe in offering the following benefits:


  • Generous EMI share option scheme

  • Pension plan

  • Team Socials & Team Lunches

  • Regular "lunch and learns"

  • Regular professional development opportunities

  • Free nights out in London's coolest venues

  • Office pool table

  • Friday night beers


 


About Hire Space

As the UK’s leading venue booking platform, Hire Space is disrupting the events industry through transformational technology. We’ve built something that is used by over a million event bookers each year and we’re just getting started.

We work with over 10,000 clients including The Guardian, Facebook, Time Out, BuzzFeed and Sky who rely on our expertise and technology to help organise their events. We also work closely with a community of over 6,000 venues in the UK to help our clients book venues through our platform. We are increasingly working overseas too - from New York to Berlin and Singapore.

Through EventLAB we’ve created a platform for event organisers to learn, develop, get connected, and discover what’s new in the world of events. This is achieved through our flagship event every October, our regular Series events and the EventLAB Podcast.

We’re a growing team of ambitious, talented and passionate individuals who enjoy working in an exciting and collaborative environment that encourages innovation and contribution from everyone. We're also technical innovators who solve problems and release innovative products that will change the events industry. Our strong culture is also important to us and we work relentlessly to make sure that Hire Space is a fantastic place to work.

 

Ultimately, we're here to make event booking a joy

items.title: Tech Co-Founder
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=21, c=2, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=13}
items.content:
Who are Zapple?


Zapple is a next-generation bank.  We combine assets, cash, current accounts and savings into a single product.  Your employer could pay you in pounds but you may want to store that as Bitcoin, gold and oil.  When you use your debit card you can choose to sell off some of your assets in real time.  Your wealth and available funds fluctuate based on the assets that you control.  Savings ratios can be enforced to help with long-term asset growth.  Depending on your individual risk profile, cash and less risky assets can form the majority of your asset baskets.


The first phase of our journey is operating a digital currency exchange and digital bank in the UK.  Our exchange is live and we're currently going through FCA licensing for offering current accounts.  Multi-asset banking will follow in late 2020.


Please check out the links below for a recent pitch deck and explainer video.


Pitch Deck: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1NoXVOXtH6K3qpJ4mnSdOW03AS4JQ_ZgF


Explainer: https://drive.google.com/open?id=19vf7K613r71giNKZMzR3AYX0_6ZJElXU


 


Who We're Looking For


We're looking for a technical co-founder to join our team.  We've developed a lot of our MVP but need to expand the team to cope with our ongoing expansion.  We're currently based on a C# .Net Core backend with Angular for our front-end web components.  We're looking for someone as comfortable with code as they are with infrastructure.  Someone who wants to help shape the direction of Zapple and carve out their own niche.   We're looking for someone who can help us complete the MVP and join us in this vision.


 


The Offer


For now, we can offer a token salary and equity with a view to the role becoming full time in early 2020.  You'll be our first fully salaried employee once the next round completes and will help to build our dev team.  We're also offering equity.


You've got the opportunity to carve out whatever role you want for yourself moving forwards - whether it is hands-on or moving into a CTO role that oversees a fintech business.  We're looking for someone who knows where they want to go and who sees how Zapple can work with them to provide that growth.


As a company we offer fully flexible and remote working and are working towards a four-day working week for all members of staff.  We believe in the wellbeing of our staff above all else and want to enshrine this in our culture as we grow.  If this sounds like it might be interesting to you then we'd love to hear from you.


We are based in Edinburgh but this role can be remote.

items.content:
Think Ministry

 

Full Stack .NET Developer

We are looking for a full-stack .NET Software Developer responsible for the design, development, coding, customization, configuration, testing, and deployment of enterprise solutions.  The candidate will be joining a small, distributed team which consists of other senior and junior developers, quality assurance engineers, and scrum master. Ideally, we will begin on a part-time contract basis for 90 days with the intent to hire full-time thereafter. Responsibilities * Work through assigned issues in Jira and communicate questions/blockers/suggestions in a timely and clear manner to other members of the team * Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications * Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to mitigate and address these issues * Help maintain code quality, organization, and patterns * Following patterns, practices, and conventions established in existing code * Must utilize their own computer and development environment to perform work * Hours must be documented and reported by the 1st of each month * Must attend 2 sprint stand-up meetings per week * Must attend 2 code review meetings per week during regular business hours * Authoring new applications and application features * Ensuring high performance on mobile and desktop * Cooperating with the front-end developers and quality assurance engineers * Communicating with external web services Skills and Qualifications * Professional, precise communication skills including asking for help/direction when needed * Proficiency using A SP.NET MVC and ASP.NET Core 2.2+ using C# * Proficiency of .NET MVC and SaaS application structures and methodologies * Proficiency with Microsoft SQL Server queries, stored procedures, schema, and best-practices * Proficiency with utilizing source control (GIT) * Experience with JavaScript (preferably ES6) * Experience with Webpack and Babel * Understanding of Progressive Web Application standards, conventions, and approaches * Understanding of Service Oriented Architecture * Understanding of OAuth/OpenID Connect flows for authentication/authorization * Ensuring a clear dependency chain, in regard to the app logic as well as the file system * Experience with Web API Applicants must be US based with solid English language skills, both written and spoken.
