items.content:
Remote Senior Consulting Software Engineer .NET / C#

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: IT Recruitment
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: A-Line Staffing Solutions | No office location

Technologies

c#
.net
angularjs
tdd

Job description

A-Line Staffing is seeking a qualified candidate for the position of Remote Senior Consulting Software Engineer .NET / C#

Please review the desired qualifications listed below and apply or contact Nate Namiotka with questions.

Responsibilities include:

  • Develop guidelines for other software engineers that helps them build and implement code that is scalable, stable and secure.
  • Be a hands-on software engineer who can write quality code, assist with problem solving, root cause analysis, trouble shooting and coaching.
  • Understand big picture from a business standpoint within the context of the application.
  • Write technical blogs and be active in Open Source Community.
  • Apply Design Thinking techniques on application design.
  • Lead agile software development efforts as a Technical Leader.
  • Review and take actions based on application metrics, including but not limited to code quality, business metrics and performance metrics.

Requirements:

  • Looking for a Software Engineer with 5-8+ years of .NET & C# development experience.
  • Experience in AngularJS, HTML, CSS & Front end Development required
  • Strong SQL Experience required
  • Any database and Angular knowledge a big plus.
  • AWS and DevOps experience a large plus as well.
  • Experience working in an Agile environment is a big plus.
  • Coach other software engineers on practices such as TDD, ATDD and pair programming.
  • Understand advanced concepts of Containers, Micro-Services, Continuous Delivery and Continuous integration, and guide the team to setup a DevOps environment for the applications they build and support.
  • This is a REMOTE position, so you will have the ability to work from home from anywhere in the US.

I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Nate Namiotka – A-Line Staffing

Apply now

Benefits

  • Health Insurance
  • 401K
  • Long term Contract

items.title: Hiring Amazing Tech Writers
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=16, c=0, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=6, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Hiring Amazing Tech Writers

Company: Guiding Tech
Location: Anywhere
Job Type: Contract
Description

Guiding Tech is looking to hire writers who totally love tech and gadgets, and can't get enough of it!

We are an evergreen tech site. We publish the best tutorials, how-tos, guides, lists, comparisons, tips and tricks on consumer tech topics like Android, iOS, Windows, Mac, Web Apps and more. Our content is well-researched and in-depth with a focus on details and presentation.

We are particularly looking for writers who have experience in the following domains:

  • Mac
  • Smart home gadgets
  • TVs / streaming devices
  • Pro-photo tools like Lightroom
  • Pro-video editing tools like Adobe software
  • Wearables
  • PC Hardware

If you have experience in / passion for the above topics then feel free to apply.

You can be located anywhere as long as you know your tech in and out, and can write in coherent and grammatically correct English. You should also know how to take great screenshots and how to edit images to make them look better.

People with prior experience in tech content writing will be preferred. And you should have time to submit a minimum of 2 articles per week.

Make sure to check our site to see the kind of content we produce.

Application Instructions
Email details about yourself and links to your work to abhijeet at guidingtech dot com, with the subject line Problogger Job Ad.

items.title: 100% Remote-working Full-stack .NET Developer - £75k
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=27, c=4, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=29}
items.content:
Avanti Recruitment is working with a Digital Media company based in central London who are on the market for a remote-working Full-stack .NET Developer. They have a custom-built platform which has really progressed their global success in the last few years, you will play a key part in the ongoing developments for this platform, they are highly data-driven so building and improving their back-end system is vital to the plans for next year.

They are looking for Developers who take pride in their work and are looking to make an impact in a market-leading product, you will be working in a close-knit team of high-quality developers where you will have the freedom to use front-end frameworks of your choice. They are looking for solid all-rounders, so strong experience in C#, MVC and Javascript is essential. They are currently re-writing their front-end in Vue.js, exposure to this isn't a must-have as training will be provided based on your knowledge and experience.

They look for individuals who doesn't think of coding as a job but as a passion, you will play a key part working with experienced all-round developers reporting into the Product Manager. To ensure everything is on course they conduct morning stand-ups and code reviews are conducted on a regular basis.

Full Tech Stack:

C# MVC
WebAPI
Javascript - HTML / CSS
Azure
Vuejs
Knockoutjs
SQL Server
Personal portfolio - GitHub / Stack overflow
Computer Science degree

This is an excellent opportunity to work with a market-leading product which has taken the industry by storm with great career prospects. The company are based in central London and can offer up to £75k with Share options, 3% matched pension, 24 days holiday, plus 4-5 days off during Christmas and regular social events including nights out.

For more information on this exciting opportunity please apply online now! Feel free to contact Luke Johnson at Avanti Recruitment to discuss the role

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=13, c=2, mobile=0, go=8, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
Software Engineer 100% Remote Working

Our Client who is a leading global online technology business with an annual turnover in excess of 1.5bn, is calling for talented developers to join the remote home working team. Due to the growth of the company, they're looking to expand their capabilities via a home working team. This is in addition to the already excellent in house team. You will be home based, but don't worry, you'll feel very much involved and a part of the team. You will the in regular contact with in house team, they make sure that you're not forgotten about and due to the latest technologies they have available, it ensures that you're able to work seamlessly on your own or as part of the team.

What You'll Be Doing

As a remote worker you will be managed and supported by a dedicated remote Development Manager as well as a technical team where your primary tasks reside. You will not only be challenged to deliver high quality code but will also be required to assist in the analysis and estimation of work items. You will be exposed to enterprise scale architectures and processes that are geared towards quality and delivery, all will receive all the support needed to succeed in this role. There are several roles we're supporting with so if you match any of the skill sets below please get in touch.

Skills You'll Need;

C# , MVC , SQL / JavaScript or TypeScript / .Net, NoSQL, MS SQL, Golang,

A proven track record in web development

Experience of working with distributed or concurrent, multi-tiered application

You will need to be driven, a self-starter and have a strong self-discipline to be able to work from home whilst working to tight deadlines. You will also have strong communication skills and a passion for technology and development. This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of a company that currently holds the top spot in it's field.

What You'll Get

Competitive Salary reviewed annually

5 weeks per annum plus public holidays

Private pension contribution

Bonus Scheme

Gym membership

Life Assurance Scheme - 4 x basic annual salary

Income Protection Scheme

Discounts across health care, mobile phone packages and vehicle hire / purchase

Training and Development

If you think you've got what it takes to be part of a market leading brand, apply today

items.title: Senior Developer - .NET Core / Azure - Perm - Glasgow / Remote - to £6
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=78, c=2, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Senior Developer - .NET Core / Azure - Perm - Glasgow / Remote - to £60k

How would you like to work on industry leading, pioneering software projects on a daily basis? Not only that but youll get to work with a fantastic development team of highly skilled programmers in a company who take a mature attitude to things like flexible and remote working. If this appeals to you, read onâ€¦

Our client is expanding and they have a great opportunity for a talented Senior Developer to join their team. You will work primarily on a major project to redevelop our clients cloud based, SaaS application. Using cutting edge technology, this is a fantastic chance to be involved in shaping the technical direction of a product used by hundreds of thousands of end users. If you are an excellent problem solver who is passionate about technology and you have previous experience with cloud application development, get in touch now!

This company are based in Glasgow city centre and they are happy to consider applications from candidates that tick all the boxes and wish to work fully remotely with occasional office visits.

What you will be doing:
Back end development of our clients SAAS platform
Develop multi-tenant, cloud facing secure APIs
Work closely with other developers as part of small, close knit project teams
Communicate effectively in a collaborative team environment

What you will bring:
Strong commercial experience using cloud based technologies (Azure (preferred) or AWS)
Good experience with .NET Core or C# /.NET (version 4.5 or above) / ASP.NET / MVC (version 5 or above)
Experience with databases such as MongoDB (preferred), SQL Azure or alternatively SQL Server
Must have experience of developing secure software solutions
Microsoft certification (MCP, MCSD) or any knowledge of React would be nice to have

Now is the perfect time to join our client and be a part of their future success. A competitive salary plus benefits that include a fully paid Pluralsight subscription are on offer for the winning candidate. Dont miss out, take the next step and apply with your CV for immediate consideration

items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
C#, Python, Java, Mendix, SQL Server, MySQL

If you are a Senior Software Developer with experience, please read on!

This is a 100% remote position that requires experience with Mendix.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

As a Senior Software Engineer you will be an integral part of our engineering team, serving as a key contributor to solution design, development and release. You will be working with key stakeholders from the product and business teams as well as other software developers to ensure proper delivery. The software engineer contributes to system design, database design, and feature execution while adhering to coding standards and participating in code reviews.

You understand software design, standard coding principles, database operations and code optimization. In addition, you understand the Mendix platform; specifically how to apply domain models, UI models and microflows to deliver scalable solutions.

In this role you will focus on delivering products and solutions that directly impact internal and external user?s day-to-day productivity. You must be able to balance the desire system elegance against the new for rapid delivery.

What You Will Be Doing

Your focus will be:
Software design, prototyping and development
Following standard coding practices
Work on assignments as directed
Coordinate works across the team

Major responsibilities of this role include:
Establish and maintain coding standard and practices
Participate in software design decisions
Coordinate work on individual sprints
Work with the development team, scrum master and product owners
Collaborate with team members on coding decisions

What You Need for this Position

Education:
A Bachelor of Science in computer science is highly desired for this role or highly demonstrable experience in performing software development, and design work

Experience:
3+ years in a software development role as an individual contributor
1+ years working with Mendix on major business systems
Experience with web applications and mobile applications

Skills & Abilities:
Strong interpersonal skills working with business and technical teams
Strong organizational and process management skills
High degree of creativity and problem-solving ability
Able to set and manage priorities
Strong writing abilities with user requirements, use cases and user stories

What's In It for You

- Vacation/PTO
- Medical
- Dental
- Vision
- Relocation
- Bonus
- 401kSo, if you are a Senior Software Developer with experience, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=66, c=4, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=45}
items.content:
Sitecore Software Developer

US-Remote Potential & Salary Flexibility

One career opportunity with a choice of regional locations to work out of for this on-site role at a great company - very much into a healthy workplace, terrific and unique benefits with a culture that allows for participation in all stages of the development from defining the project to design to implementation, debugging, and testing. You will deploy the application across multiple systems in a fast-paced project applying an agile development schedule.?

If you are comfortable being in the thick of things working with developers, project leads and project stakeholders to understand and resolve issues and clarify requirements this is a great opportunity. Expect to respond to production issues conducting root cause analysis and identifying the underlying issue.

Compensation will vary depending upon the work location market and combination of education and experience. Generous benefits and time-off days, medical, vision, dental, 401k, flex spending account and more.?

?

Must-Have:?
  • 5+ years of experience developing on the Sitecore platform (working knowledge of Sitecore 9.0 preferred; Sitecore 8.2+ required)
  • 5+ years of experience designing and developing software using C# and ASP.NET MVC
  • 2+ years as a team lead with excellent communication skills and proven ability to mentor/coach fellow developers regarding best practices
  • Experience building, inspecting, and managing deployments using Azure DevOps
  • Experience using Glass, Synthesis, or another ORM Mapper/Wrapper for Sitecore, Experience using TDS and/or Unicorn for tracking Sitecore item changes
Nice-to-Have:
  • Experience with: Object-oriented programming and computer science foundations
  • Software security best practices
  • .Net Framework, Visual Studio, C#, ASP.NET, WCF, Web API/REST Services.
  • HTML5, CSS, JSON, XML, AJAX, JavaScript and JavaScript frameworks (JQuery, Angular, React etc.)
  • Current Web UI frameworks such as Bootstrap and Foundation
  • Relational database design and development
  • Agile methodologies and tools, unit testing, content management systems
  • Experience w/ the following is a plus: Azure PaaS, Helix, Sitecore certification
  • BS Computer Science or equivalent experience preferred

items.title: Remote Malware Reverse Engineer Lead
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=1, dotnet=43, c=24, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
Location: Charlotte, NC
Description:

Note: Potentially remote for candidates that possess all of the required skills


We are seeking an experienced Malware Analyst/Reverse Engineer to perform malware analysis and reverse engineering in support of incident response, investigative analysis, threat hunting, and research on existing and emerging cyber threats. The role will involve in-depth analysis of static and behavioral analysis of complex malicious code utilizing various tools, including disassemblers, debuggers, hex editors, un-packers, virtual machines, and network sniffers. The candidate will perform the functions of malware analyst/reverse engineer and serve as a liaison for Threat Services for the Global Fusion Center, and mentor and collaborate with the threat hunting, incident handling/response, and forensics teams.


Key Responsibilities

  • Use expertise in malware analysis/reverse engineering to evaluate and analyze complex malicious code.
  • Perform reverse-engineering for suspected or known malware files, determining the TTPs associated with the code.
  • Develop custom tools designed to automate analysis.
  • Perform research around malicious software, vulnerabilities, and exploitation tactics, and recommend preventative or defensive actions.
  • Produce detailed reports identifying attributes and functionality of malware, and IOCs that can be used for malware identification/detection, to include behavior, identified infrastructure used for command and control, and mitigation techniques.
  • Assist in identifying (hunting) and profiling threat actors and TTPs.
  • Develop host and network based signatures to identify specific malware via heuristic and/or anomaly based detection methods.
  • Participate in formal technical briefing and proposals.
  • Perform as an Information Security SME in the several of the following areas:
  • Malicius code behavior
  • Threat Intelligence
  • Incident Respnse
  • Web Applicatin
  • Lg analysis (statistical modeling, correlation, pattern recognition, etc.Microsoft platform (Server, workstation, applications)
  • Key Responsibilities (Cont'd)
  • Open Systems platfrms (Linux, UNIX, VM Ware ESX)
  • Netwrking (firewalls, IDS/IPS, packet capture)
  • Databases (Oracle, SQL Server, DB2, IMS)


  • Providing mentorship and support to teammates regarding malicious file analysis/behavior, communication/rapport with other divisions and various levels of leadership, technical expertise, and career development.
  • Capable of identifying need & driving solutions, and providing guidance, in an autonomous manner.


Job Qualifications

  • Bachelors and/or Masters Degree in Engineering, Computers Science, or related field
  • 7+ years overall technical experience in either reverse engineering/malware analysis, threat intelligence, incident response, security operations, or related information security field.
  • 5+ years experience in application design/engineering, including but not limited to programming/scripting, Windows/Linux system administration, RDBMS/NoSQL database administration, etc.
  • 2+ years experience in penetration testing or ethical hacking
  • 2+ years experience with reverse engineering tools like IDA Pro, Ghidra, OllyDbg, Windbg, and Wireshark.
  • 2+ years experience of Python scripting to automate analysis and reverse engineering tasks (and Bash or Powershell or PerlC/C++).
  • 2+ years experience of x86, ARM, and x64 architectures.
  • Ability to reverse engineer binaries of various types including: x86, x64, C, C++, and .NET.
  • Strong understanding of Windows Operating System Internals, Windows APIs, and writing and analyzing DLLs.
  • Recent experience developing custom software and hardware tools to assist in performing reverse engineering and vulnerability analysis.
  • Strong understanding of common network and application stack protocols, including but not limited to TCP/IP, SMTP, DNS, TLS, XML, HTTP, etc.


Experience with security operations tools, including but not limited to:

  • SIEM (e.g. Splunk, ArcSight)
  • Indicatr management (e.g. ThreatConnect)
  • Link/relatinship analysis (e.g. Maltego, IBM i2 Analyst Notebook)
  • Signature develpment/management (e.g. Snort rules, Yara rules)


Contact:

This job and many more are available through The Judge Group. Find us on the web at
- provided by Dice

Lead Software Engineer – Raleigh, NC, Hartford, CT, or Eden Prairie, M

United States, North Carolina
Company: UnitedHealth Group

Overview

In this position, you will be responsible for developing andsupporting business solutions to many strategic programs. Primary contributorin designing, coding, and supporting applications which are aligned to the ITstrategy, leveraging enterprise components and capabilities, advancing thestate of our IT assets, and expanding and improving upon our enterpriseengineering strategy. Lead and mentor other developers on the team toprovide a consistent experience.

The position also allows for communicating and many differentgroups in the IT organization and various parts of the business. The teamusually works on many small projects instead of a few very large projects tobetter reduce the monotonous factor and it also critical to identify, designand solve complex problems, while being able to reuse as many of our previoussolutions as possible.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Design,implement and maintain applications within all phases of the SoftwareDevelopment Life Cycle (SDLC)
  • Develop, test, implement andmaintain application software working with established processes
  • Communicateeffectively with other engineers and QE
  • Identifyproduction and non-production application issues
  • Identifyopportunities to fine-tune and optimize applications
  • Providetechnical support and consultation for an application and infrastructurequestions
  • Serveas a mentor to less experienced developers
  • Developingpioneering approaches to emerging industry trends
  • Contributeto development team and help to achieve key business objectives
  • Contributeto large, complex projects to achieve key business objectives
  • Collaboratewith the team on application architecture design and decision-making
  • Designand implement application enhancements in collaboration with different teams
  • Solvesunique and complex problems with broad impact on the business
  • Translateshighly complex concepts in ways that can be understood by a variety ofaudiences
  • Thecandidate must be able to work in a fast paced, high pressure environment

Required Qualifications:

  • 5+years of full Software Development Life Cycle experience
  • 5+years of MVC design/development experience
  • 4+ yearsof REST API development
  • 3+years of angular experience
  • 2+years of SQL Server
  • S tronganalytical, problem solving skills, must be able to work well with teams
  • Bachelor’sdegree OR HS Diploma/GED plus 5+ years equivalent experience

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Knowledgeof Windows operating system details in a plus
  • Experienceworking in Agile Methodology
  • Experiencewith Source Control systems (example: TFS / Azure DevOps)
  • Experienceworking in a virtual team environment
  • Strongcommunication and interpersonal skills

TechnologyCareers with Optum . Information and technology have amazing power totransform the health care industry and improve people’s lives. This is whereit’s happening. This is where you’ll help solve the problems that have neverbeen solved. We’re freeing information so it can be used safely and securelywherever it’s needed. We’re creating the very best ideas that can most easilybe put into action to help our clients improve the quality of care and lowercosts for millions. This is where the best and the brightest work together tomake positive change a reality. This is the place to do your life’s bestwork.(sm)

Diversitycreates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal EmploymentOpportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants willreceive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion,sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexualorientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, geneticinformation, or any other characteristic protected by law.

UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to passa drug test before beginning employment.

Software Developer / Full Stack Developer

C#, .Net, MVC, Web API, Javascript, Angular

Remote Wroking Options

Are you an established Software Developer looking for a greenfield development opportunity? Are you excited by the idea of joining a newly created team with the sole purpose of developing next generation systems, platforms and web applications?

In this role you will be presented with a great opportunity to use your expertise in .Net & Full Stack development to build next generation solutions and help a company realise their huge potential. This is an exciting time to join the business who work with best of breed technologies to provide scalability and performance. You will be able to influence technology choices and designs at the early stages of product development.

Scope of Activity

Work with product management and stakeholders to understand functional and business requirements.
Engineer high quality, maintainable and testable code using test-driven and behaviour-driven development techniques as appropriate.
Maintain skill set and stay up to date with emerging technologies.Summary of Skills & Experience

Experience in commercial software development with C# and the .Net framework.
Web application development with Javascript and web services.
A good understanding of test-driven development practices using automated unit tests with tools such as NUnit.
Interest in application of automated testing to software development processes.
Self-motivation with sound technical skills, enthusiasm with an excellent work ethic.Other beneficial knowledge

Behaviour-driven development techniques using tools such as SpecFlow.
Interest in application of automated testing to software development processes
User interface/experience expertise.

They also offer flexible and remote working options, a range of company benefits and a friendly and sociable working environment with structured and organised development practices. You wont be working 12 hours a day or firefighting backlogs and bugs, the company have their foundations in good running order!

items.content:
Software Engineer, Fabric at Health Catalyst

Remote
  • US Remote
  • Full time
  • REQ-130

Our mission is to be the catalyst for massive, measurable, data-informed healthcare improvement through:

  • Data: integrate data in a flexible, open & scalable platform to power healthcare’s digital transformation
  • Analytics: deliver analytic applications & services that generate insight on how to measurably improve
  • Expertise: provide clinical, financial & operational experts who enable & accelerate improvement
  • Engagement: attract, develop and retain world-class team members by being a best place to work

Who you are:

  • You are a “T-shaped” developer with deep expertise in backend services and broad expertise in many other technologies.
  • You have a passion for continuous learning, excellence and innovation.
  • You have a systems-focused approach to building and maintaining software.
  • You connect the dots between the business need to the software features you create.
  • You have a track record of being analytical, methodical and quality driven.
  • You make the teams you work on better by mentoring others, by constructively reviewing Pull Requests, testing software, and taking support rotations.
  • You are eager to improve your Software Development practices in a culture that values software as a craft, collaboration and DevOps principles.
  • You are passionate about making the world a better place by building great software.

What you’ll own:

  • As a Software Engineer on our Fabric team, you will be responsible to maintain, extend and create and support scalable microservices that serve as the foundation for Health Catalyst’s Data Operating System (DOS).
  • As a member of a team that lives DevOps principles you will participate in the full software development lifecycle by helping to plan, build, test, deploy, operate and respond to the continuous feedback that comes back from the instrumentation you build into the software.

Experience you’ll need:

  • Junior to Mid-level software development experience
  • A successful candidate will have experience with multiple programming languages, paradigms, and runtimes especially in the implementation of larger complex systems.
  • Building and maintaining scalable microservices.
  • Expertise in C# / .NET
  • Proficiency in SQL

Technologies and tools you may use and interact with here (* – required):

  • Windows* – Server 2016, 2019
  • Linux – Centos, Ubuntu
  • Tools – Git*, Azure DevOps*, Visual Studio*, Docker, Kubernetes
  • Services – IIS*, Nginx, RabbitMQ
  • Azure – An increasing number of PaaS services
  • Data Stores – SQL Server*, SQL Data Warehouse, ElasticSearch
  • Frameworks/Standards – ASP.NET Web API*, OData*, OAuth2*, OIDC*, Angular
  • Healthcare Specific Standards – HL7v2, CCD, FHIR

Languages in use here that you may be involved with (* – required):

  • C# / .NET*
  • SQL*
  • Powershell*
  • ARM (Azure Resource Manager)
  • TypeScript
  • Javascript
  • Python
  • R

The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed in this job function. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, and indeed additional responsibilities may be assigned by Health Catalyst.

At Health Catalyst, we appreciate the opportunity to benefit from the diverse backgrounds and experiences of others. Because of our deep commitment to respect every individual, Health Catalyst is an equal opportunity employer.

Apply for job

items.content:
Olo

Senior Software Engineer Test

Do you love to eat?  Are you passionate about testing and technology?  At Olo, Test Engineers create code-based testing solutions for teams.  We work as embedded testers, meaning that we are full, collaborative, members of feature teams. We are responsible for driving the quality culture on our teams as well as helping teams derive technical solutions for hard-to-test problems. As a Senior Test Engineer,  you’ll work with developers and QA Engineers to prevent defects and performance issues through testing and automation. This includes a variety of testing activities, not just updating or building frameworks, but whatever is needed to cast a wide quality net. We believe testing is a craft requiring training and skill. We invest in our employees. Our employees love to learn, and challenge themselves, and challenge each other to grow. We encourage collaboration, leadership, and mentorship. You can work at Olo’s headquarters in New York City’s Financial District or remotely from anywhere in the U.S. In fact, more than two-thirds of our engineering team is remote. Responsibilities * Collaborating with developers and product owners: * Contributing to planning and design * Reviewing product code * Formulating test scenarios * Measuring and monitoring quality of production code * Planning and developing test automation frameworks * Automating test scenarios using the frameworks * Knowing and using design patterns where appropriate * Setting up infrastructure to run tests * Creating and managing test data * Setting up dashboards/alerts for reporting test results in real time * Teaching others good quality and testing practices * Communicating test strategies, results, and how-tos in writing * Identifying and developing tools to assist manual and exploratory testing Requirements * You have recent hands-on system, end-to-end, load, performance and integration test experience for APIs and services * You could write production code, but you prefer to excel at automated test solutions * You’ve worked in a .NET shop before * You are test-savvy and can talk knowledgeably about the latest new approaches to test automation * You have excellent written and verbal communication skills and can articulate a test strategy * You’re a critical, creative thinker who keeps the big picture in mind * You are tech-savvy and are comfortable with AWS infrastructure, CI tools, and containerization * You’re comfortable with pair development/testing or mob development/testing * You reside in the US and have a legal right to work in the U.S.

C# Developer (Remote)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: X-Team | No office location

Technologies

c#
microservices
wcf
tsql
angularjs

Job description

Most important:

  • Experience working with C#
  • Experience with microservice design and implementation
  • Experience with WCF
  • Experience with T-SQL
  • Experience with AngularJS
  • Experience with Elastic

Nice to have:

  • Experience with CQRS
  • Experience with Event Sourcing
  • Experience with BPMN
  • Experience with working remotely
  • Familiar/involved with open­ source projects

Personal:

  • Independent, self-motivated
  • Fluent in English, written and spoken
  • Proven track record of always learning and growing
  • Proactive attitude
  • Possess a spirit of generosity

Perks:

  • Get the chance to work with big brands like Riot Games, Fox Broadcasting, Kaplan Inc...
  • Live and work in one of our roaming hacker houses (X-Outposts) around the world.
  • Work from anywhere as part of a community of digital nomads.
  • Join our vibrant community, filled with opportunities to learn new skills together in study groups, join clubs (photography, gaming, etc.) and get free camera equipment/games/conferences/courses/massages/etc., charitable fundraisers, fitness & yoga programs (+gym membership), etc. This is the community to be in if you're a remote developer.
  • We’ll provide up to $2,500 in funding for your learning and growth through our Unleash program, which provides opportunities to unleash your potential through initiatives that help you grow as a developer and explore your passions more each day. 
Apply now

About X-Team

X-Team is an international company founded in Melbourne, Australia, that helps companies scale their development teams by providing them with extraordinary teams of developers from around the world.

We are 100% remote and believe in building a world where developers can have access to an environment of growth and incredible opportunities regardless of where they live.

We are also a community of people dedicated to unleashing our potential. We’ve fostered a unique, active lifestyle and culture around this idea that continues to attract thousands of developers to apply every day.

We proactively support our developers, fund their learning and growth, connect them in roaming hacker housesaround the world, and give them a remote environment that motivates and inspires them on a daily basis. While other companies merely place and drop their talent, we provide unified teams of developers centered around the same beliefs, values, and lifestyle. 

We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age and aid them in being able to do so properly with the right people. We work with big brands like Riot Games, Fox Broadcasting, Kaplan Inc., Coinbase, Google, Twitter and more…

Who is X-Team meant for?

A potential X-Teamer is a developer with experience working on large-scale, remote teams and projects. They are self-motivated, proactive, and have a strong team spirit. If you're tired of the traditional freelancing platforms, you'll be happy to hear that we’re so much more. X-Team is a community of like-minded individuals, carefully chosen to ensure that they can become part of the community of the most motivated people in the world who come together to unleash their potential. What we've created is truly special and not merely a faceless platform. X-Team is where developers go to feel truly at home together while becoming more motivated than they've ever been.

Benefits

  • Get the chance to work with big brands
  • Live and work in one of our roaming hacker houses around the world
  • Work from anywhere as part of a community of digital nomads
  • Join our vibrant community
  • We provide up to $2,500 in funding for your growth & wellbeing
  • Gym reimbursement

.Net Core Full Stack Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Information Technology
Company size: 1k–5k people
Company type: Public
Company: Cronos Groep | Kontich, Belgium

Remote details

Office Location: Kontich, Belgium. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

.net
c#
sql
html
css

Job description



Als ervaren .NET Full Stack Developer voel je je helemaal thuis in .NET web development en Javascript front-end frameworks. Dankzij je allroundkennis kan jij bij Upcore-klanten projecten van A tot Z in handen nemen.

Je bent een gepassioneerde ontwikkelaar die zijn of haar kennis en ervaring telkens naar een hoger niveau wil tillen. Je houdt ervan om onze klanten met de nieuwste technologieën te assisteren bij het ontwikkelen van toonaangevende (web)toepassingen. Je voelt je thuis bij Upcore en bij de organisaties waarvoor je via ons aan de slag gaat.

Je CORE-waarden
  • .NET expertise met minstens 4 jaar ervaring in C# en .NET Framework. De laatste 2 jaar paste je die kennis toe in .NET Core, Entity Framework Core, …
  • Ervaring met Web API, REST, Json en XML
  • Hands-on ervaring met MS SQL Server en T-SQL
  • Diepgaande kennis van HTML, CSS, LESS/Sass, Javascript, Gulp, Grunt en Webpack
  • Vertrouwd met front-end Javascript frameworks zoals Angular, React, Vue, …
  • Thuis in testing (Unit tests, Integration test): xUnit, MSTest, NUnit, Moq, ...
  • Correct en nauwkeurig wanneer het gaat over source control, branching en code check-ins via GIT/TFS
  • Betrouwbaar als SCRUM-teamplayer: je weet hoe en waarom je je sprint goals moet halen


Jouw mooi-meegenomen-toegevoegde-waarden
  • Hands-on ervaring met OAuth, JWT tokens, Swagger en OData
  • Kennis van Typescript en NodeJs
  • Ervaring met Azure Services


Wil jij onze klanten met bovenstaande technologieën dichter bij hun businessdoelstellingen brengen? Dan zorgen wij voor aantrekkelijke uitdagingen en een no-nonsense werkomgeving. En voor de kansen om je kennis en skills optimaal in te zetten en te laten groeien. Elk jaar een interessante opleiding? Of een ticket voor die must-see conferentie? Consider it done!

Work-life balance is meer dan een hippe term in rekruteringsmagazines. We hechten er bij Upcore oprecht veel belang aan. Verwacht dus gerust meer dan die standaard 20 vakantiedagen. Oh ja, extra's zoals een laptop, een aantrekkelijke bedrijfswagen met tankkaart, een maaltijdvergoeding, hospitalisatieverzekering, groepsverzekering, … Wij regelen dat voor jou.

En last but not least, bij Upcore zorgen we ervoor dat je kan samenwerken met een groep gepassioneerde collega's die elkaar technisch blijven uitdagen. Onze mensen zijn nu eenmaal de core van onze onderneming. En daar hoor jij binnenkort misschien ook bij!
Apply now

About Cronos Groep

Upcore is een hecht team van consultants die elk met hun jarenlange ervaring gespecialiseerd zijn in een specifiek vakgebied binnen de .NET ontwikkeling. Van Full Stack development over pure back-end integraties tot Microsoft Azure: onze klanten rekenen op ons. We werken bij klanten als Digipolis, C&A, de Vlaamse overheid, GO! en Cronos Groep. Altijd met aandacht voor onze eigenheid en voor dat unieke ik-voel-me-thuis-bij-Upcore-gevoel.

Benefits

  • /

items.content:
COMPANY CONTEXT


We are looking for an entrepreneurial full stack developer to help build an innovative B2B Fintech platform in the field of currency risk management & FX trading.  This is an exciting opportunity to work with a founding team to build a product that will disrupt the murky world of traditional banking and brokerage firms by providing SME clients with transparency and quality advisory solutions.


 


For the right candidate we offer both financial rewards, plus the opportunity to be the principle system architect and drive product development in an exciting, disruptive fintech start up.


 


To date the company has:



  • Developed unique and valuable IP within currency risk and FX trading analytics

  • Built a functional trading cost analysis platform in Java

  • Established a competent sales & marketing team and distribution strategy

  • Generated revenue from advisory services


 


THE ROLE:


 


As the first technology hire across the entire business, you’ll need to hit the ground running.  You are a passionate technologist that owns delivery from concept through to completion.


 


You will:



  • Collaborate on software design, maintenance, troubleshooting, and feature implementation

  • Provide accurate story and project estimations

  • Consistently write clean, modular, readable, testable and maintainable code

  • Create database schemas that represent and support business processes

  • Analyze and implement system architecture and structure requirements

  • Implement Unit test Requirements


 


The first task will be to bring our Java-based Transaction Cost Analysis tool from prototype to production MVP. The long-term responsibility will be to create a user-friendly SaaS platform. At a later stage this may involve utilizing a body of R & Python-based algorithms developed by one of our team. You will be responsible for designing the architecture, database structure and code the front end and back end.


 


SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:


 


The below list of skills is a starting point for technical discussion, obviously it is unlikely a candidate will have deep experience in all the areas stated. However, we expect suitable candidates to bring ideas and experience that will help guide decisions around suitable technologies and appropriate tech stack for maximum firm success. 


 


Skills



  • Full stack/backend development skills including C# and .NET.

  • Front-end: React or similar modern frontend libraries/frameworks

  • Back-end: .NET, C#, SQL Server, Web service (REST, ODATA, WCF), Oracle, AWS

  • Knowledge of Python

  • Strong understanding of Agile/Scrum methodology, Eclipse, Git and Jira

  • Experience with API integration, financial applications experience is especially valuable

  • Experience with version control workflows and tools (preferably Git)

  • Experience architecting large software systems and enterprise integrations, RDBNS databases in general

  • Solid grasp of and fluent in common design patterns tools

  • Relevant experience in the following technologies: Angular2, Bootstrap, CSS, Groovy, HTML, jQuery, REST Web Services and XHTML


 


Experience



  • Professional experience (>5 yrs) years of commercial development experience with a track record of delivering high-quality software products

  • Bonus to have worked in financial services or start-up environments and comfortable in an entrepreneurial environment 

  • Experience creating scalable processes, applications, data infrastructure and tools for integration with 3rd party services / systems

Sitecore Software Developer

US-Remote Potential & Salary Flexibility

One career opportunity with a choice of regional locations to work out of for this on-site role at a great company - very much into a healthy workplace, terrific and unique benefits with a culture that allows for participation in all stages of the development from defining the project to design to implementation, debugging, and testing. You will deploy the application across multiple systems in a fast-paced project applying an agile development schedule.?

If you are comfortable being in the thick of things working with developers, project leads and project stakeholders to understand and resolve issues and clarify requirements this is a great opportunity. Expect to respond to production issues conducting root cause analysis and identifying the underlying issue.

Compensation will vary depending upon the work location market and combination of education and experience. Generous benefits and time-off days, medical, vision, dental, 401k, flex spending account and more.?

?

Must-Have:?
  • 5+ years of experience developing on the Sitecore platform (working knowledge of Sitecore 9.0 preferred; Sitecore 8.2+ required)
  • 5+ years of experience designing and developing software using C# and ASP.NET MVC
  • 2+ years as a team lead with excellent communication skills and proven ability to mentor/coach fellow developers regarding best practices
  • Experience building, inspecting, and managing deployments using Azure DevOps
  • Experience using Glass, Synthesis, or another ORM Mapper/Wrapper for Sitecore, Experience using TDS and/or Unicorn for tracking Sitecore item changes
Nice-to-Have:
  • Experience with: Object-oriented programming and computer science foundations
  • Software security best practices
  • .Net Framework, Visual Studio, C#, ASP.NET, WCF, Web API/REST Services.
  • HTML5, CSS, JSON, XML, AJAX, JavaScript and JavaScript frameworks (JQuery, Angular, React etc.)
  • Current Web UI frameworks such as Bootstrap and Foundation
  • Relational database design and development
  • Agile methodologies and tools, unit testing, content management systems
  • Experience w/ the following is a plus: Azure PaaS, Helix, Sitecore certification
  • BS Computer Science or equivalent experience preferred

items.content:
Loop

Data Engineer

Work from home for a fun, successful, profitable company. AutoLoop is looking for an experienced Data Engineer to work on several large projects. Knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server administration and T-SQL are a must. The applicant must be a fast learner and willing to dive in quickly. Our proprietary software utilizes unique targeting capabilities, capitalizes on our extensive data analytics giving our engineers interesting projects to work on, lots of autonomy to make good coding decisions, and we try to keep meetings to an absolute minimum.  This is a remote (domestic United States only) position, unless you live in the Tampa Bay area. We are only considering senior level candidates who are self-motivated and can be productive without someone standing over their shoulder.  Responsibilities: * Design, develop, and maintain search related functionality in the application * Work on a team dedicated to the ongoing core needs of the software platform * Work with engineers on other teams when necessary to fix SQL performance related issues * Assist the Database Administrator in various administrative tasks and act as backup when necessary  Required Skills and Experience: * 8-10+ years’ experience as a software developer and/or SQL administrator. * Extensive hands-on experience with Microsoft SQL Server / T-SQL, as well as experience with C# and the .Net Framework. * Able to troubleshoot performance bottlenecks for SQL queries and read query execution plans. * Good understanding of the following: types of indexes and when to use them, transaction isolation levels and windows analytical functions. * Knowledge of administration tasks with SQL Server like backups, log backups, checkdb and index/statistics maintenance. * Knowledge of high-availability cluster setup is preferred. * Experience with AWS, Elasticsearch, and streaming solutions would be beneficial in this role. * Prefer experience with Redis. * Preferred experience with Scrum/Agile as well as test-driven development and various automated testing frameworks. * Experience with .Net Core preferred. * Leadership experience is helpful, but not required.  Job Benefits & Perks: * Paid health, dental, and vision insurance. * 401K, paid holidays, and PTO. * Competitive wage; compensation commensurate with skills and experience.

items.title: Wildbit: Senior Software Engineer, Postmark
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=26, c=4, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Software Engineer, Postmark


Description
Postmark (a product of Wildbit) is a cloud email infrastructure product that allows businesses to send and receive transactional email from their applications. We aim to make email seamless, dependable, and easy for development teams. We exist to support our team, and our values and products reflect the care and intention that we operate with. You would be joining a small team of ~30 people, where you would have the opportunity to make a big impact on the evolution of the Postmark product


Our Technology
We are transitioning Postmark from a co-located mixed-OS environment to a cloud-native app running exclusively on Linux. You will be primarily working in C#/.NET, but other technologies and infrastructure you will use on a daily basis include: AWS services (such as Lambda, RDS, and ECS), MySQL, Elasticsearch, RabbitMQ, Kafka, Grafana, Kibana, and others.


The Role
As a Senior Software Engineer on the Postmark team, we’re excited for you to:
  • Contribute C# code to improve and enhance our APIs and backend services
  • Design software that strikes the right balance between delivering on business needs and delivering the quality of code you are proud to ship
  • Guard the health of our systems — you’ll be part of an on-call schedule and help mitigate system abuse by spammers
  • Set clear expectations around your work, knowing when to break down nebulous tasks into manageable parts, and communicating that to your teammates
  • Shape the Postmark system over time to remain highly reliable and scalable, through system design, infrastructure improvements, code optimizations, or other technical initiatives
  • Be a partner to Customer Support, Product, and Design, and collaborate with those teams cross-functionally

Typical day-to-day tasks could include:
  • Designing and scoping out the software needed to support company initiatives
  • Building RESTful APIs
  • Adding and managing new services and queues
  • Maintaining Windows and Linux servers
  • Building and scaling out infrastructure using automation tools such as Terraform and Ansible
  • Optimizing queries in MySQL

Requirements:
Engineers on Postmark have a tremendous amount of autonomy on the technical direction of our product, but are held to a high standard for the reliability, maintainability, and usability of code they write. With this autonomy, individual engineers are expected to evaluate the current landscape of our product, as well as consider future directions to develop the best solution for today, with the understanding that there will be inevitable time constraints associated with growing and maintaining a successful product like Postmark.

You will be a great fit for this role if you have a strong technical point of view that is coupled with pragmatism and an ability to execute. You should also be an excellent communicator and approach your conversations with a level of care and empathy.


Ideally, you have:
  • Experience designing, building, and operating large systems with varying scalability, availability, and performance requirements
  • Experience with various deployment architecture paradigms, such as zero downtime deploys, canary servers, etc.
  • Implemented web services using Twelve-Factor app principles
  • Familiarity with email-specific topics, such as SMTP, SPF, DKIM, DMARC, etc.
  • Managed system infrastructure and built system automation tools

Benefits:
  • Remote-first team — we optimize for asynchronous communication and creating space for focused-work
  • Full health benefits for US-based team members: medical, dental, vision (100% paid for employee and spouse/dependents)
  • Company-paid retreats
  • Quarterly profit sharing
  • Conferences and career development
  • Currently experimenting with 4-day work weeks with flexible hours

Wildbit is an equal opportunity employer and proud of it
We’re committed to building a diverse team, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. At our core we believe deeply in diversity, inclusiveness, and acceptance as all being key parts of a healthy team.

items.content:
For the past 7 years, 1partCarbon has been successfully designing and building an extensive variety of software systems and apps for our clients.


We are currently looking for a mid-level .Net/C# software engineer to join our existing team in Edinburgh.


Your primary role will be working on our existing .Net projects.


1partCarbon has a team approach to development and your role will include sharing your knowledge and experience with your colleagues and contributing to the overall health of the projects you are assigned to, contributing to code reviews and deploying solutions regularly.


Working and communicating with customers is an essential part of the job. You will take part in project inceptions, and help choose the correct technology for projects moving forward.


We promote an Agile approach to development with pair programming where appropriate both on site and remotely.


As a company we endeavour to apply the best technologies for the job in hand, so we use a range of technologies.


Our projects range from Ruby on Rails full stack projects to embedded systems to micro serviced APIs serving iOS and Android mobile clients. We currently have projects using, .Net, Azure, Elixir, Go, Python, C, C#, React, Rails, Ionic, Ansible, Terraform and AWS.


Your Skills


The ideal candidate(s) will have at least 4 years .Net, C# software development and Azure experience and a willingness to learn new technologies when required.


A degree in computer science or related discipline would also be welcome.


We offer a competitive package, mid-level salaries currently range from £32k to £45k, plus bonuses, and the possibility of shares in our spin out and fast growth equity funded companies. (To date we have invested in or spun out 3 separate technology companies)


We operate from a central location in Edinburgh.


We offer a friendly and welcoming environment where people share responsibility can express themselves, learn and contribute but also work hard to achieve results.

items.content:
Search Engine Evaluator

 Search Engine Evaluators conduct research, evaluation and feedback on search engine results by, but not limited to, measuring the relevance and usefulness of web pages in correlation to predefined queries, by providing comparative analysis of sets of search engine results and various other techniques.



Appen is looking for highly educated individuals for an exciting work from home, independent contractor opportunity. Applicants must be self motivated and internet savvy. This is an opportunity to evaluate and improve search engine results for one of the world's largest internet search engine companies.



Search Engine Evaluators will need to combine a passion for analysis with an understanding of various online research tools. Applicants must be detail oriented and have a broad range of interests.



Ideal Search Engine Evaluators will possess the following skills:
  • Excellent web research skills and analytical abilities.
  • Have in-depth, up-to-date familiarity with current country's social culture, media, and web culture
  • Excellent comprehension and written communication skills in English (Bilingual skills is a plus)
  • Broad range of interests, with specific areas of expertise a plus
  • Possess and use a self-supplied high speed internet connection (DSL, Cable Modem, etc.)
  • Possess and use a self-supplied Android phone version 4.1 or higher, Windows phone version 8.1 or higher, or an iPhone version 4s or higher

Languages Needed:
  • English
  • Chinese
  • Burmese
  • Spanish
  • Korean
  • French

All candidates are required to take and pass a qualification exam before becoming a Search Engine Evaluator. There are three parts to the exam: a theoretical component and two practical components. Supplied study materials can be used during the exam.



Please Note: We are unable to offer more than one Search Engine Evaluator position per IP Address. 

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
C#, Python, Java, Mendix, SQL Server, MySQL

If you are a Senior Software Developer with experience, please read on!

This is a 100% remote position that requires experience with Mendix.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

As a Senior Software Engineer you will be an integral part of our engineering team, serving as a key contributor to solution design, development and release. You will be working with key stakeholders from the product and business teams as well as other software developers to ensure proper delivery. The software engineer contributes to system design, database design, and feature execution while adhering to coding standards and participating in code reviews.

You understand software design, standard coding principles, database operations and code optimization. In addition, you understand the Mendix platform; specifically how to apply domain models, UI models and microflows to deliver scalable solutions.

In this role you will focus on delivering products and solutions that directly impact internal and external user?s day-to-day productivity. You must be able to balance the desire system elegance against the new for rapid delivery.

What You Will Be Doing

Your focus will be:
Software design, prototyping and development
Following standard coding practices
Work on assignments as directed
Coordinate works across the team

Major responsibilities of this role include:
Establish and maintain coding standard and practices
Participate in software design decisions
Coordinate work on individual sprints
Work with the development team, scrum master and product owners
Collaborate with team members on coding decisions

What You Need for this Position

Education:
A Bachelor of Science in computer science is highly desired for this role or highly demonstrable experience in performing software development, and design work

Experience:
3+ years in a software development role as an individual contributor
1+ years working with Mendix on major business systems
Experience with web applications and mobile applications

Skills & Abilities:
Strong interpersonal skills working with business and technical teams
Strong organizational and process management skills
High degree of creativity and problem-solving ability
Able to set and manage priorities
Strong writing abilities with user requirements, use cases and user stories

What's In It for You

- Vacation/PTO
- Medical
- Dental
- Vision
- Relocation
- Bonus
- 401kSo, if you are a Senior Software Developer with experience, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

CyberCoders

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Your Right to Work - In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

items.content:
To apply, email a Word format resume to Tatiana at [Click Here to Email Your Resum?] Thank you!

Title: **REMOTE** IAM Engineer - RSA

We are currently seeking a contingent worker to join our global IAM team.? The ideal candidate will be responsible for supporting RSA SecurID Access (Authentication Manager and RSA Prime Kit) to ensure the integrity and availability of two factor authentication services.?The candidate should have experience with the installation, integration, and operations of RSA SecurID Access in an enterprise environment.

Key Responsibilities
  • Provide RSA SecurID Access Product/Infrastructure/application Support
  • Maintains and optimizes tools, processes, technical drawings and documentation
  • Provides analysis of potential risk to information security and recommends solutions
  • Collaborates with high-performing teams and engineers throughout the company to accomplish common goals
  • Provides on-time delivery of tasks in support of project milestones
  • Monitor and fine tune system performance
  • Design and execute operational maintenance procedures
  • Analyze system logs to identify and resolve potential or existing issues
Requirements
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in an enterprise IT environment
  • Bachelor's degree desired (years of experience may be substituted for degree)
  • Advanced understanding of integrating applications with RSA SecurID Access
  • Advanced understanding of Authentication Manager Bulk Admin tool (AMBA)
  • Subject Matter Expert in RSA SecurID Access products and capabilities
  • Ability to effectively and efficiently troubleshoot and address technical issues with RSA SecurID Access
  • Ability to produce, update, and maintain, high quality documentation
  • Self-starter, strong communication and presentation skills
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to diagnose and troubleshoot technical issues
  • Advanced knowledge of?Tomcat?
  • Good knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript
  • Basic knowledge of Java
Desired Skills
  • Advanced knowledge of Linux commands and troubleshooting
  • General knowledge and understanding of PKI
  • General knowledge and understanding of ServiceNow
  • General knowledge of LDAP technologies, Microsoft Azure, and Windows Hello for Business
  • General knowledge of AWS (Amazon Web Services) and Docker
EEO Employer
Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. items.content: McNamara • Salvia, a nationally recognized structural engineering firm with offices in Boston, Miami, and New York is seeking a talented Software Developer. This is a great opportunity for individuals who want to work on exciting building projects while using cutting edge technology to impact the industry. The goal of this position is to develop software tools to add efficiencies to the structural design process, optimize workflows and integrate computational design into design processes. This position requires creative thinking with challenging new problems to solve in a fast-moving environment. ResponsibilitiesWork on every stage of software development projects: analysis, design, programming, testing, release and maintenance.Develop stand-alone applications, scripts, Excel Macros, and plug-ins for structural design and building modeling tools.Contribute to existing software development projects and to the architecture of software tools and data within the company.Work with Engineers and Modelers within the company to boost their initiatives through programming efforts.Research the latest design trends and technologies RequirementsBachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related discipline (Software Engineering).2-4 years of experience working as a software developerProficient with the Microsoft .Net framework (C#/VB.net), Python, and Excel VBA (Knowledge of other programming languages and frameworks is a plus)Good understanding of 3D Math applied to 3D Graphics and ModelsExperience with source control systems like GIT or SVNExperience in visual programming (Dynamo and Grasshopper) is desirableExperience with database design + JSON and XML data structures is highly desirableExperience with 3D modeling software and programming with 3D engines is highly desirableKnowledge of BIM Tools: Revit, Revit SDK, AutoCAD, and/or Rhino is desirableExposure to engineering software including ETABS, SAFE, and RAM is a big plusExcellent communication skills with team members

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=48, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Microsoft Windows Engineer at Phoenix Cybersecurity

Remote | High-paying

Client Services – United States – Full Time

Phoenix Cybersecurity is looking for Microsoft Windows engineers to join our client delivery team. This is a remote, work-from-home position with no travel required. [A location is specified because it’s a requirement of the job posting platform. But you can work from wherever you want, anywhere in the United States.]

Required Qualifications:

  • Must hold an active Secret or Top Secret security clearance
  • Must hold at least one of the following certifications: GIAC GCWN, MCSA/MCSE 2012/2016, Microsoft Certified Master (MCM), Microsoft Certified Architect (MCA), Microsoft Certified Solutions Master (MCSM)
  • 5+ years of experience in Information Technology
  • 5+ years of experience managing Windows Server
  • 3+ years of experience with Windows scripting using PowerShell

Desirable additional qualifications:

  • Experience with RSA Archer 5.0 – 6.X
  • Experience with FISMA, NIST, and CIS security controls and accessibility standards
  • Experience with robotic process automation, auditing practices, processes and methodologies
  • Understanding of compliance reporting practices and integrated security system architecture
  • Understanding of network design concepts and operations including managing and troubleshooting IIS and PKI
  • In-depth experience with general IT security concepts, network security, and monitoring practices/methodologies
  • Experience with security-based software applications and tools
  • Experience with technical writing, including strong verbal and written skills and Microsoft Office skills

Salary range: $80k to $100k annually

Apply for job
